0.title: Shakespeare's only signed and dated portrait goes on sale for over ₹96 crore
0.article_body: A portrait of William Shakespeare, which is said to be the only signed and dated portrait of the English playwright, has gone on sale for more than £10 million (over ₹96 crore). A work of painter Robert Peake, the portrait is signed and dated 1608. The portrait has been displayed in London and its owner remains anonymous.

1.title: Ajay Devgn's 'Drishyam 2' collects ₹3 crore in advance booking
1.article_body: Ajay Devgn and Shriya Saran-starrer 'Drishyam 2' has collected ₹3 crore in advance booking after selling around 1.25 lakh tickets by Thursday afternoon. The film will be a sequel to Ajay's 2015 film 'Drishyam', which was directed by late filmmaker Nishikant Kamat. 'Drishyam 2', which is a remake of the 2021 Malayalam film, is directed by Abhishek Pathak.

2.title: SC to hear Gautam Navlakha, NIA's pleas on house arrest verdict tomorrow
2.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday will hear applications by activist Gautam Navlakha and the National Investigation Agency (NIA) over the apex court's order allowing his house arrest. The SC on November 10 allowed Navlakha to be placed under house arrest for a month on medical grounds. Navlakha has been jailed in connection with the Bhima Koregaon violence case.

3.title: J&K issues notices for cancelling land allotment under industrial scheme
3.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir government issued final notices to 586 entities on Thursday for cancellation of the land allotted to them under the state's 'industrial development scheme'. The notices were issued following failure of these entities to pay the land premium and execute the lease deed, an official said. Of these, 462 entities are in Kashmir and 124 in Jammu.

4.title: No truth in former Pak PM Imran Khan’s conspiracy claims: US
4.article_body: The US government has again categorically dismissed ex-Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan's allegations that Washington orchestrated his ouster from office earlier this year. "As we've previously said, there has - there is not and there has never been a truth to these allegations," Vedant Patel from US State Department said, when asked about Khan's sudden U-turn on the conspiracy claims.

5.title: Daughter hasn't told me if she wishes to join films: Ajay Devgn
5.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn has said that his daughter Nysa has still not told him or Kajol if she wants to join the film industry. "She is just a teenager...As of now, she is studying overseas. If she decides to pursue a career in the film industry, it will be her choice," he added. Ajay will feature in 'Drishyam 2'.

6.title: Govt cannot make EC dance to its tunes: Kiren Rijiju
6.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said that the Election Commission is an independent body and the central government cannot make the poll panel dance to its tunes. He added that the "Election Commission of India is an impartial, transparent, empowered and independent body". Rijiju was responding to the opposition's charges that the EC acts on the BJP and government's directions.

7.title: US cannot stop us from buying oil from Russia: Pak Finance Minister
7.article_body: Pakistan Finance Minister Ishaq Dar said the US cannot stop them from purchasing Russian oil. Referring to his meeting with US State Department officials, Dar said, "We told...American officials...US cannot stop us from buying oil from Russia because...India is also buying oil from Russia." He reiterated that Pakistan will try to purchase oil from Russia on similar terms to India.

8.title: Tata plans to merge 4 carriers including Vistara under Air India: Report
8.article_body: Tata Group is considering a plan to integrate its four airline brands under Air India, as per reports. The group plans to merge Air India with full-service carrier Vistara, along with budget carriers Air India Express and AirAsia India. Reportedly, Tata Group and Singapore Airlines, the joint owners of Vistara, have agreed to a merger.

9.title: El Salvador to buy 1 Bitcoin every day starting Friday: President Bukele
9.article_body: El Salvador President Nayib Bukele took to Twitter to announce that the country will start buying one Bitcoin a day starting Friday, November 18. El Salvador became the first country to use Bitcoin as legal tender in June last year. Since then, the Central American nation has reportedly purchased 2,381 Bitcoin at an average price of $43,000.

10.title: Plea to order probe into Jayalalithaa's death not maintainable: Madras HC
10.article_body: The Madras High Court (HC) on Thursday said a petition seeking a CBI probe into late Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's death at a private hospital in Chennai in 2016 was not maintainable. The court was hearing a petition from social activist RR Gopaljee. The petitioner cited the Justice Arumugasamy Inquiry Commission report, which raised several questions about the death.

11.title: Google, Karnataka govt sign MoU to support emerging startups
11.article_body: Google and Karnataka government signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to support emerging startups across the state and promote innovation. Google, in collaboration with the Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society, will work with women-led startups and provide them access to training, partners and expertise on resources. Google stated it has mentored over 1,500 startups over the years.

12.title: B'luru child found dead in Kolar lake, search on to find missing father
12.article_body: The body of a missing toddler was recovered from a lake in Karnataka's Kolar on Wednesday. The two-and-half-year-old girl, Jiya Parmar, who resided in Bengaluru, went missing along with her father on Tuesday. Jiya's father had reportedly informed his wife that he'd drop Jiya at the pre-school, however, both of them did not return home.

13.title: SC to hear plea challenging collegium system for judge appointment
13.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea challenging the collegium system for judicial appointments in the apex court and the high courts. The plea, mentioned by Advocate Mathews J Nedumpara, calls the collegium system synonymous with nepotism and favouritism. The plea also sought to revive the National Judicial Appointments Commission (NJAC) for the appointments of judges.

14.title: 3 held in connection with blast on Udaipur-Ahmedabad railway track
14.article_body: Three persons, including a juvenile, have been detained in connection with the blast on the Udaipur-Ahmedabad railway track, a police official said. "Another person from whom they purchased the explosive has also been detained," ATS and Special Operation Group (SOG) ADG said. Preliminary probe said the accused were upset as they were not given compensation after their land was acquired.

15.title: Citi to sell Nykaa shares worth ₹1,000 crore via block deal: Report
15.article_body: Citigroup has launched a block deal to sell shares in cosmetics-to-fashion retailer Nykaa worth ₹1,000 crore, CNBC Awaaz reported. The block deal involves TPG Capital as the seller, with the deal offering a discount of up to 0.5% on the current market price. Citigroup had last week too completed a block deal to sell 0.6% shares worth ₹306 crore.

16.title: I-T dept discloses ₹1,300 cr black money after raids in K'taka realty sector
16.article_body: Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) said the Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted income of over ₹1,300 crore after conducting several raids. It added that raids were carried out against people involved with some Karnataka-based real estate developers. "Undisclosed assets in the nature of cash and gold jewellery worth more than ₹24 crore have also been seized," CBDT said.

17.title: US weekly jobless claims fall despite rise in tech layoffs
17.article_body: The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits dropped by 4,000 for the week ended November 12, US Labor Department data showed on Thursday. The initial unemployment claims decreased to 2,22,000, from previous week's 2,26,000. This comes amid an increase in layoffs in the technology sector, with Twitter, Amazon and Meta announcing thousands of job cuts this month.

18.title: Assam, Mizoram govts hold talks over interstate border dispute issue
18.article_body: A crucial meeting was held in Guwahati on Thursday between Assam and Mizoram governments over the interstate border dispute issue. Assam ministers Atul Bora, Chandra Mohan Patowary and Mizoram ministers Lalchamliana, Lalruatkima and other officials were a part of the meeting. Bora said both sides agreed to abide by the resolutions encapsulated in the Joint Statement of August 5, 2021.

19.title: 38 Indians trapped in 'transnational crime syndicates' in Myanmar rescued
19.article_body: As many as 38 Indian nationals who were victims of job offers from 'transnational crime syndicates' in Myanmar were repatriated to the country earlier today, raising the total count of such individuals to over 160. The repatriated individuals departed from Yangon for Kolkata, from where they will head to their respective hometowns, authorities confirmed.

20.title: VHP, Bajrang Dal members destroy banners of Ram Rahim at event in UP
20.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad (VHP) and Bajrang Dal members tore the banners and hoardings of Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim, a murder and rape convict, at a 'satsang' programme held in Uttar Pradesh's Shahjahanpur. Ram Rahim is currently out on parole. Police stopped the event that was being held without obtaining prior permission.

21.title: You'll not know peace until you leave, we see you: Ukraine to Russia
21.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Defence has shared a video on Twitter, which claims to show five Russian soldiers being killed by the Ukrainian army in a border region. The video has been captioned, "We see you, Russians. Even in the dark. You will not know peace until you leave Ukraine." The video has garnered more than 400,000 views.

22.title: Fairfax denies reports of stake sale in Bangalore International Airport
22.article_body: Fairfax Financial Holdings has denied reports that it is planning to sell its stake in Bangalore International Airport Ltd (BIAL). The clarification came hours after a Bloomberg report emerged stating Fairfax's Indian arm is planning a $3.7 billion IPO of BIAL next year. Earlier reports also claimed that the Adani Group has approached Fairfax to buy a stake in BIAL.

23.title: UN-facilitated shipment of grain from Ukraine must continue: India
23.article_body: The UN-facilitated shipment of grain and fertilisers from Ukraine to the rest of the world via the Black Sea must continue, India has said at a briefing of the UN Security Council. The UN-brokered deal, finalised on July 22, had helped check global food prices amidst the Russia-Ukraine war. The agreement is set to expire on November 19.

24.title: Uddhav, others pay tributes to Bal Thackeray on his death anniversary
24.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray paid tributes to his father and Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray at his memorial at Mumbai's Shivaji Park on his death anniversary on Thursday. He was accompanied by his wife Rashmi Thackeray, their son Aaditya Thackeray and senior leaders of Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray). CM Eknath Shinde had visited the memorial on Wednesday night.

25.title: Indecent & pathetic: BJP on Rahul Gandhi's remarks on Savarkar
25.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra on Thursday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for "insulting" Veer Savarkar during Bharat Jodo Yatra, calling his remarks indecent and pathetic. "This is very shameful that Rahul Gandhi did a press conference in Maharashtra and insulted the son of the state and freedom fighter," Patra said. He added that Rahul Gandhi should apologise to every Indian.

26.title: Bal Thackeray memorial 'purified' with gaumutra after Shinde's visit
26.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) workers allegedly 'purified' Shiv Sena founder Bal Thackeray's memorial with gaumutra (cow urine) after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde visited the site on Wednesday. A purported video of the incident has surfaced online. Shinde had visited the site on the eve of Bal Thackeray's death anniversary. Uddhav Thackeray and Shinde head rival factions of Shiv Sena.

27.title: What do you need these many breaks for: Shastri on India head coach Dravid being rested
27.article_body: Reacting to India head coach Rahul Dravid being rested for the white-ball series against New Zealand, Ravi Shastri said, "What do you need that many breaks for?" He added, "You get your 2-3 months of the IPL, that's enough for you to rest as a coach." Shastri further said, "I think a coach should be hands on, whoever he is."

28.title: TN DGP sits on floor, has lunch with jail inmates during inspection
28.article_body: For the first time, the DGP of the Tamil Nadu Police (Prisons and Correctional Service) Amaraesh Pujari, during an inspection, sat on the floor and had lunch with inmates of the Puzhal Central Jail. Pujari listened to the grievances of the inmates and discussed measures aimed at their welfare, a senior state prison official said.

29.title: He wasn't criticising: China as video of Xi confronting Trudeau goes viral
29.article_body: After a video of Chinese President Xi Jinping confronting Canadian PM Justin Trudeau went viral, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said it "was a short conversation both leaders held during the G20 summit". "[It] shouldn't be interpreted as...Xi criticising or accusing anyone," the ministry said. Xi was reportedly confronting Trudeau over an alleged "leak" of details from a meeting they held.

30.title: Holiday on Nov 22 and 25 in 4 districts of Haryana due to panchayat polls
30.article_body: The Haryana government has declared a public holiday on November 22 and 25 in Faridabad, Palwal, Fatehabad and Hisar districts due to panchayat polls. The state government offices, boards, corporations and educational institutions will remain closed on these days. Zilla Parishad and Panchayat Samiti elections will be held on November 22, followed by Panch and Sarpanch elections on November 25.

31.title: Ahir regiment protest to be held in Gurugram tomorrow; police issues traffic advisory
31.article_body: Members of the Ahir community will be holding a protest near the Kherki Daula toll plaza in Gurugram on Friday demanding a separate regiment in the Indian Army. Police said protestors would march from the toll plaza to Hero Honda Chowk. Gurugram Traffic Police has listed alternative routes that commuters can take while travelling between Delhi, Jaipur, Gurugram and Manesar.

32.title: Bodies of 8 Indians killed in Maldives fire incident sent to India
32.article_body: The bodies of eight Indians who were killed in a fire incident in Male last week have been repatriated to India, the Indian High Commission in Maldives said on Thursday. "We thank Maldivian authorities for their support in this regard," it added. Ten people died in the incident that occurred in a garage below a cramped living quarter.

33.title: 2 Russians, 1 Ukrainian sentenced to life imprisonment for downing of MH17
33.article_body: A court in Netherlands on Thursday convicted and sentenced in absentia two Russians and a pro-Moscow Ukrainian separatist to life imprisonment for murdering 298 people, following the downing of Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 over Ukraine in 2014. Prosecutors contended the Boeing 777, which was flying to Kuala Lumpur from Amsterdam, was hit by a missile shot by Ukrainian separatists.

34.title: Man lifts & throws 8-yr-old girl to ground in Kerala; video surfaces
34.article_body: A 31-year-old man lifted an eight-year-old girl, who was waiting outside a Madrassa for her uncle, and threw her to the ground in Kerala's Manjeshwar on Thursday. The accused was arrested later, police said. A video of the incident shows the man walking towards the girl and hitting her.

35.title: I'd been with animal flow teacher for 6 months for 'Bhediya': Dhawan
35.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that he had been with an animal flow teacher for around 6 months for his role in 'Bhediya'. "Too much hard work has gone into getting the physique right as the director (Amar Kaushik) didn't want my body to be tight...asked to cut down on the muscles," Dhawan added. Kriti Sanon also features in the film.

36.title: Centre moves SC seeking review of order releasing 6 Rajiv Gandhi assassination convicts
36.article_body: The Centre has filed a review petition in Supreme Court against its order allowing the release of six convicts in the Rajiv Gandhi assassination case. The Centre told the apex court that it wasn't heard in the matter as it wasn't made a party during the proceeding. The apex court had ordered release of the convicts on November 11.

37.title: Streaming devices maker Roku to lay off 200 employees in US
37.article_body: Roku, video streaming devices maker, will cut 5% of its staff or about 200 employees in US due to "current economic conditions". Roku will incur costs up to nearly $31 million in severance and other layoff payments in the fourth quarter. The firm's shares have fallen nearly 75% this year and is the latest tech company to plan layoffs.

38.title: Ensure only B'deshi migrants who back TMC enlisted in voter list: Bengal MLA
38.article_body: A West Bengal MLA has allegedly asked TMC workers to ensure only those Bangladeshi migrants who back the ruling party in the state are enlisted in the voters' list. "Many...people are coming...from Bangladesh. [Several of them] vote for BJP based on Hindu sentiments," MLA Khokan Das was purportedly heard saying in a video. Das allegedly made these comments in Bardhaman.

39.title: Won't allow conversions by fraud & deceit in Madhya Pradesh: CM Chouhan
39.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said that he won't allow religious conversions by fraud and deceit in the state at any cost. "[There's] a conspiracy going on [here]. There are some people who forcibly marry our daughters and later try to convert them," he added. Chouhan made these comments at a PESA awareness programme in Narmadapuram district.

40.title: Former bureaucrat Dr CV Ananda Bose appointed as Governor of West Bengal
40.article_body: Retired IAS officer Dr CV Ananda Bose has been appointed as the Governor of West Bengal, President Droupadi Murmu's office said. He'll be replacing La Ganesan, who assumed charge of the office after former Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was elected as India's 14th Vice-President. He's previously served as Chief Secretary to Government of India and Principal Secretary to Chief Minister's office.

41.title: Kajol had a big crush on actor Akshay Kumar: Filmmaker Karan Johar
41.article_body: Actress Kajol, during her appearance on 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10', was asked by host Maniesh Paul to name her crush in Bollywood beside actor Ajay Devgn. To this, filmmaker Karan Johar replied, "She had a big crush on Akshay Kumar." The actress, who has worked with Johar in three films, will next star in 'Salaam Venky'.

42.title: MP CM to campaign for BJP in poll-bound Gujarat on November 18
42.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan will campaign for the BJP in poll-bound Gujarat on November 18, the CM's office said on Thursday. BJP leaders including Narottam Mishra, Vishvas Sarang, Arvind Bhadoria and Inder Singh Parmar have already been campaigning for BJP in Gujarat. Chouhan will address election meetings in Mandvi and Abdasa Assembly segments of Kutch district on Friday.

43.title: De-occupation of Crimea will end war, ceasefire won't: Ukraine's Prez
43.article_body: During an interview, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "A simple ceasefire won’t do the trick. Unless we liberate our whole territory, we will not bring peace." President Zelenskyy said the de-occupation of Crimea, which was annexed by Russia in 2014, and the country's long-occupied eastern Donbas region are conditions for bringing the nine-month war to an end.

44.title: Creditors realise ₹2.43 lakh crore through insolvency resolution till Sept
44.article_body: Banks, financial institutions and other creditors of stressed companies have realised ₹2.43 lakh crore through CIRPs (Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process) till September 30, an official report said. The fair value of the assets available with these corporate debtors was estimated at ₹2.14 lakh crore and a liquidation value of ₹1.37 lakh crore against the total claims worth ₹7.91 lakh crore.

45.title: 5G to add up to 2% of India's GDP amounting to $180 bn by 2030: Report
45.article_body: The 5G network technology is expected to contribute about 2% to India's GDP amounting to $180 billion by 2030, according to a report by NASSCOM and Arthur D Little. The report added that India is expected to have over 500 million 5G users by 2027. The report also expects 5G to enable a $1.5-trillion revenue potential globally by 2030.

46.title: Terrorism is Pakistan's one of foremost problems: PM Shehbaz Sharif
46.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Wednesday said, "Let us make no mistake. Terrorism continues to be one of Pakistan's foremost problems." His comments came after six policemen were reportedly killed after two terrorists opened fire on a police van in Pakistan's Lakki Marwat. Tweeting over the same, PM Sharif said, "No words are enough to condemn [the] terrorists' attack."

47.title: Never in my career have I seen such a failure of corporate control: FTX's new CEO
47.article_body: Bankrupt crypto exchange FTX's new CEO John Ray said, "Never in my career have I seen such a complete failure of corporate controls and such a complete absence of trustworthy financial information as occurred here." He also criticised FTX's Co-founder and ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried for making "erratic and misleading public statements". Earlier, Binance cancelled a deal to buy FTX.

48.title: TMC's Anubrata Mondal arrested in multi-crore cattle smuggling scam
48.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Thursday arrested Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal in connection with a multi-crore cattle smuggling scam case. Earlier in the day, he was questioned inside the Asansol jail where he is currently lodged. The central probe agency has also questioned Mondal's daughter Sukanya at least thrice in this case.

49.title: UK is already in recession, declares UK's Finance Minister
49.article_body: The United Kingdom's Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt on Thursday said that the UK is now in recession and the economy is headed towards further shrinkage. Hunt tabled his emergency budget with £55 billion ($65 billion) of tax hikes and spending cuts. "There may be a recession made in Russia, but there is a recovery made in Britain," Jeremy Hunt said.

50.title: 2 Islamic teachers teach 'jihad' to 14-yr-old in an Assam madrassa; held
50.article_body: Assam Police have arrested two Islamic teachers for allegedly torturing a 14-year-old who accused them of teaching 'jihad' in a madrassa, officials said. The student alleged that the accused told them that they would receive blessings from Allah for "destroying" Hindus. He added he was beaten mercilessly for not attending their special classes post 11 pm.

51.title: 10-month-old boy dies during cold-cough treatment in Durg, doctors booked
51.article_body: Four doctors and three paramedical personnel of a private hospital in Chhattisgarh's Durg have been booked for alleged negligence after a 10-month-old boy died during treatment for cold and cough. Officials said the district health authority has cancelled the registration of Siddhi Vinayak Hospital and imposed a fine of ₹20,000 on its management. The baby, Shivansh Verma, died in October.

52.title: Bombay HC extends no coercive action against Anil Ambani till Dec 19
52.article_body: Bombay High Court has extended until December 19 its earlier order directing the Income Tax department to not take any coercive action against Reliance Group Chairman Anil Ambani. This comes after I-T department sought more time to file its affidavit. The I-T department had issued a show cause notice to Ambani in August for allegedly evading ₹420 crore in taxes.

53.title: 3 found guilty of shooting down plane over Ukraine in 2014, killing 298 on board
53.article_body: A Dutch court on Thursday convicted three men of murder for their role in shooting down Malaysia Airlines passenger flight MH17 over Ukraine in 2014. Two Russian former intelligence officers and a Ukrainian separatist leader were found guilty of downing the plane and killing all 298 people on board. The fourth suspect on trial was acquitted.

54.title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda, Yogi among BJP star campaigners for MCD polls
54.article_body: BJP has released a list of 40 star campaigners for the upcoming Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections. The list includes BJP chief JP Nadda, Home Minister Amit Shah, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta, MP Gautam Gambhir, UP CM Yogi Adityanath, and actor-turned-politician Hema Malini, among others. The voting for 250 wards in Delhi will be held on December 4.

55.title: There was time when I couldn't choose roles as I needed money: Neena
55.article_body: Actress Neena Gupta recalled the time when she could not choose her roles as she needed money to run her house. "Today if something doesn't excite me, I simply don't do it. One of the biggest changes that have happened is the fact that I am in a position to say no," she further added. Neena recently featured in 'Uunchai'.

56.title: NHRC issues notice to Punjab govt over video of girls crossing Sutlej river to reach school
56.article_body: National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has issued a notice to Punjab government after a video showing two girls riding a boat across Sutlej river to reach school surfaced online. The video showed the girls riding on a 'bedi' (a boat manoeuvred using an overhead cable). "State has responsibility to ensure [girls'] safety and to safeguard their human rights," NHRC said.

57.title: K'taka seeks employees' one-day salary for cow adoption programme
57.article_body: The Karnataka government has issued an order approving the deduction of one day's salary of government employees to fund the state's cow adoption programme. The one-time contribution is expected to generate around ₹100 crore. Those not willing to contribute have been directed to give a written request by November 25.

58.title: About 100 startups registered with ISRO: Chairman S Somanath
58.article_body: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) Chairman S Somanath said that about 100 startups are registered with it and are working on domains of the space sector. Speaking at the Bengaluru Tech Summit 2022, Somanath added that of those, at least 10 are working on developing satellites and rockets. He also said that ISRO is working with NASA in space technology.

59.title: BJP's MCD manifesto a 'betrayal document' to mislead Delhiites: Cong
59.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba on Thursday said that BJP's manifesto for MCD elections is a "betrayal document" to mislead Delhiites. "Despite ruling...MCD for 15 years, the BJP doesn't have any achievement to highlight or any issue to project," Lamba said. "Congress will fight for...cause of...slum dwellers and fulfil its promise of free in situ flats for them," she added.

60.title: Sri Lanka Navy arrests 14 Tamil Nadu fishermen, seizes their boats
60.article_body: The Sri Lanka Navy arrested 14 Indian fishermen and seized their boats for alleged maritime boundary violation on Wednesday. The incident took place when the fishermen, who are from Tamil Nadu, were fishing in the Indian Ocean. In a separate incident, a fisherman from Rameswaram allegedly sustained an injury in his eye after being attacked by Lankan naval personnel.

61.title: T'gana govt to distribute 33 lakh health kits to girls in schools, colleges
61.article_body: Telangana government has decided to distribute 33 lakh 'Adolescent Health Kits' to girls studying in Class 8 to Class 12 of government schools and colleges to improve menstrual health. Each adolescent kit will contain a zipper bag, packs of sanitary napkins and a water bottle. The government will spend an amount of around ₹70 crore on the programme.

62.title: Bride cancels wedding as groom's family sends 'cheap' lehenga in U'khand
62.article_body: A bride in Uttarakhand cancelled her wedding after the groom's family sent her a "cheap" wedding lehenga, costing "only" ₹10,000. The groom's father reportedly gave the bride his ATM card to buy a lehenga she liked, but it went in vain. The girl got engaged to the boy in June and the wedding was to take place on November 5.

63.title: Maha speaker urges CM to build guesthouse at Ayodhya for pilgrims
63.article_body: Maharashtra Assembly Speaker Rahul Narwekar, in a letter to CM Eknath Shinde, has demanded that a guesthouse be built in UP's Ayodhya for pilgrims. Narwekar urged Shinde to request Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath to allot land for the construction of the guesthouse at Ayodhya. He also stated that he was writing to convey the wishes of "thousands of devotees".

64.title: UP CM Yogi orders construction of new court buildings in 10 districts
64.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Thursday ordered the construction of court buildings equipped with advanced facilities in 10 districts, an official release stated. He asked the Public Works Department and the Planning Department officials to submit a detailed presentation within 15 days. The CM also instructed officials to ensure strict security arrangements are made in all courts.

65.title: SEBI notifies rules on mutual fund dividends, redemption proceeds
65.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) notified new rules under which every mutual fund and asset management company has to transfer dividend and redemption proceeds to unit holders within a specified period. In case payments aren't made on time, companies would have to pay interest to unit holders. The new rules will come into effect from January 15.

66.title: Veer Savarkar's grandson lodges complaint against Rahul Gandhi for insulting Savarkar
66.article_body: Ranjit Savarkar, the grandson of late freedom fighter Veer Savarkar, on Thursday registered a complaint against Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for insulting Savarkar. "Rahul Gandhi said that Veer Savarkar took pension and worked for Britishers. [He also stated that my grandfather] worked against the country," Ranjit said.

67.title: What is a narco test which Aftab Poonawala will undergo?
67.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who's accused of murdering his live-in partner in Delhi, will undergo narco test, which is used for lie detection. In such a test, drugs like sodium pentothal are injected into accused's body, which transport them to hypnotic/sedated state. In this state, accused are understood as being incapable of lying, and are expected to divulge information that is true.

68.title: Working with trans women has been incredible in 'Haddi': Nawazuddin
68.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui, speaking about working with transgender women in his upcoming film 'Haddi', has said that their presence was "empowering". He added, "Working with real-life trans women has been an incredible experience in Haddi, an honour and a privilege to understand & learn more about the community." 'Haddi' is directed by Akshat Ajay Sharma.

69.title: K'taka HC adjourns Twitter's plea against Centre's takedown orders
69.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has adjourned Twitter's plea against Centre's order asking it to remove tweets, accounts and URLs on the platform to December 12. Twitter said government's blocking orders are against Supreme Court guidelines. Centre directed Twitter to block 1,474 accounts, 175 Tweets, 256 URLs and one hashtag between February 2, 2021 and February 28, 2022.

70.title: SEBI working on rules to regulate financial influencers on social media
70.article_body: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is working on guidelines to regulate the growing base of financial influencers who give advice to investors on social media, a senior official said. SEBI requires financial advisers to register themselves as investment advisers. In FY22, there were 415 cases of violations by influencers and celebrities in finance- and cryptocurrency-related content.

71.title: Maharashtra govt doubles pension of freedom fighters to ₹20,000
71.article_body: The state government has decided to double the pension of freedom fighters who took part in the Indian independence movement, the Marathwada Mukti Sangram and the Goa liberation struggle in Maharashtra. The pension has been increased from ₹10,000 to ₹20,000, Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis tweeted. The decision was taken at a cabinet meeting chaired by CM Eknath Shinde on Thursday.

72.title: Delhi records season's lowest temperature at 11.3°C
72.article_body: Delhi recorded its lowest temperature of the season this year, at 11.3°C, on Thursday, according to weather forecasting service Skymet Weather. The maximum temperature on Thursday was recorded at 27.5°C. The minimum temperature could drop to 10°C by Saturday, the service said. Delhi recorded an air quality index (AQI) of 260 on Thursday, remaining in the 'poor' category, CPCB said.

73.title: 135 crore young people risk hearing loss due to headphones, loud music: Study
73.article_body: Around 135 crore people aged 12-34 years globally risk hearing loss due to unsafe listening practices from exposure to listening devices like headphones and earbuds, and loud entertainment venues, according to a study. The study reviewed data from 33 peer-reviewed studies on hearing loss. The international team behind the study said the governments need to prioritise "safe listening" policies.

74.title: Rajasthan govt set to issue NRR cards for diaspora population
74.article_body: The Rajasthan government is set to provide NRR Cards to the Rajasthani diaspora living outside the state as part of the CM Ashok Gehlot government's Non-Resident Rajasthani (NRR) policy. The initiatives under the policy include 'Mhari Dani' where voluntarily contributions can be made for projects and 'Pravasi Mitra' where guidance would be provided to card holders in foreign countries.

75.title: Income tax officials raid premises linked to Bihar minister's kin
75.article_body: Premises linked to a relative of Bihar Industries Minister Sameer Mahaseth were raided across the state by income tax officials on Thursday. The officials also visited Mahaseth's residence in Patna to make enquiries. "Let me tell you one thing very clearly that neither the case is related to me nor my premises are being searched," Mahaseth said.

76.title: India has been a massive growth market: Microsoft CEO Nadella
76.article_body: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said that India has been a "massive growth market" after emerging from the pandemic. "Historically, Microsoft's presence in India was about mostly multinational companies operating in India. But for now, it's completely changed," Nadella added. He said that he is bullish about Asia, especially China and India, and plans to invest in at least 11 regions.

77.title: Twitter working on end-to-end encryption for DMs, researcher claims
77.article_body: According to noted researcher Jane Manchun Wong, Twitter seems to be working on adding end-to-end encryption to direct messages (DMs). Wong tweeted a screenshot showing a conversation key, which is helpful for encryption purposes and secures all the messages between two users. Responding to Wong's tweets, Twitter CEO Elon Musk replied with a winking face emoji, hinting towards a confirmation.

78.title: Cong prez Kharge dissolves all UP unit panels formed ahead of polls
78.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge dissolved all committees formed in Uttar Pradesh for the assembly elections this year and the party will likely reconstitute the state unit of the party. In the UP polls held in March 2022, Congress won two of 403 assembly constituencies. The unit's office-bearers would be reportedly replaced under the leadership of state Congress President Brijlal Khabri.

79.title: Tea exports rise 14.8% to 140.28 million kg in Jan-Aug period
79.article_body: Exports of tea from India increased by 14.8% to 140.28 million kg in the first eight months of 2022, according to the data by Tea Board. Exports during the same period in 2021 stood at 122.18 million kg. The CIS countries, including Russia, Ukraine and Kazakhstan, remained the largest importer with 30.56 million kg during the period.

80.title: India has entered export deals for 35 lakh tonnes sugar this season: ISMA
80.article_body: The Indian Sugar Mills Association (ISMA) said India has entered into a contract for export of about 35 lakh tonnes of sugar so far in the ongoing 2022-23 season. About 2,00,000 tonnes had been shipped last month, ISMA added. The 2022-23 sugar export policy allowed exports of 60 lakh tonnes of sugar on a quota-basis till May 31.

81.title: Alibaba reports loss of $2.89 billion in third quarter
81.article_body: Alibaba reported a loss of 20.6 billion yuan, about $2.89 billion, for the third quarter. The company attributed the losses to a "decrease in market prices of our equity investments in publicly traded companies". The company also green-lit a significant $15 billion expansion to an existing $25 billion buyback program and extended it to 2025.

82.title: SEBI to auction three properties of Saradha Group worth ₹5.21 cr on Dec 16
82.article_body: SEBI said that it will auction three properties of the Saradha Group of Companies on December 16 at a reserve price of ₹5.21 crore. The properties to be auctioned include land parcels located in West Bengal. Saradha Group of Companies allegedly mopped up ₹4,000 crore from 1.7 million depositors through chit fund operations before it collapsed in April 2013.

83.title: DSP Investment Managers to buy 9.99% stake in Equitas Small Finance Bank
83.article_body: DSP Investment Managers Private Ltd will buy a 9.99% stake in Equitas Small Finance Bank following approval from the RBI. RBI's approval is needed for an investor to acquire over 5% stake in a private sector lender. Equitas SFB said in a regulatory filing that the proposed acquisition would be consequent to the merger of Equitas Holdings with the bank.

84.title: Amazon moves SC over arbitration proceedings with Future Group: Report
84.article_body: Amazon has moved the Supreme Court for allowing arbitration proceedings with the Future Group to continue before the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC), Mint reported. Gopal Subramanium, representing Amazon, told the court that Future Group was unhappy at the tribunal counting with the proceedings. Chief Justice has asked the parties to be present before the SIAC on November 28.

85.title: Telangana Guv launches human milk bank for preterm babies in Hyd
85.article_body: Telangana Governor Dr. Tamilisai Soundararajan launched a human milk bank in Hyderabad to cater to preterm babies and other infants at KIMS Cuddles in Kondapur. Trained staff at KIMS will screen the donor mothers for infections, collect milk, pasteurize and distribute milk for babies in dire need. The bank was launched on the eve of World Prematurity Day.

86.title: Comedy circus: BJP as Nepal's national anthem played in Bharat Jodo Yatra
86.article_body: BJP has criticised Congress after wrong national anthem was played during the Bharat Jodo Yatra. BJP's Nitesh Rane tweeted, "Papu ka comedy circus." In a video, Rahul Gandhi was seen ordering to play the national song but the party instead played Nepal's national anthem. Later, Gandhi was seen surprising and gesturing to the leaders and subsequently the anthem was stopped.

87.title: B'luru NGO accused of collecting data from thousands of voters illegally
87.article_body: A Bengaluru NGO has been accused of collecting data from thousands of voters illegally by making their field agents pose as government officials. The NGO, Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Institute, reportedly received a Government Order to conduct the survey on the pretext of creating awareness about voter rights. Notably, this comes months ahead of Karnataka Assembly polls.

88.title: Chhota Rajan, 3 others acquitted in 2009 Mumbai double murder case
88.article_body: Gangster Chhota Rajan and three others have been acquitted by a special CBI court in Mumbai in a 2009 double murder case. Special judge AM Patil acquitted them as the prosecution failed to prove the case beyond "reasonable doubt". In 2009, Asif Dadhi alias Chhote Miyan and Shakeel Modak of Chhota Shakeel gang were shot dead near Mumbai's Bhendi Bazar.

89.title: Student critical after being hit on head with bat by classmate at AMU
89.article_body: A student from Jammu and Kashmir was seriously injured after being hit on the head with a cricket bat by a classmate during an altercation at Aligarh Muslim University (AMU). The student, who is admitted in the ICU, was hit following the altercation during a friendly cricket match. The attacker has been arrested and suspended by AMU authorities.

90.title: Navy sailor looking for job loses ₹8 lakh to cyber fraud in Mumbai
90.article_body: An Indian Navy sailor, who was looking for a part-time job, allegedly lost ₹8.07 lakh to cyber fraud in Mumbai. The complainant, 23-year-old Sandeep Singh, stated that he had received a WhatsApp message from "Lazada Project", which had a link attached to it. Singh was asked to buy products and was told that he'd be able to withdraw earnings later.

91.title: For the first time in 20 yrs, BJP fields Christian candidate in Gujarat
91.article_body: For the first time in 20 years, the BJP has fielded a lone Christian candidate in Gujarat Assembly elections from Vyara. BJP's candidate Mohan Konkani will fight against Congress' Punaji Gamit, who is a four-time MLA from Vyara. Konkani, a panchayat chief, is also a farmer. Notably, Christians make up about 45% of the 2.23 lakh voters in Vyara constituency.

92.title: Pune milk federations to conduct tests to rule out oxytocin traces in milk
92.article_body: Pune milk federations like Katraj and Sonai have decided to conduct the necessary tests to rule out any traces of oxytocin in the milk. Dr Madhuri Dhamale, Katraj dairy's head of department (procurement), said, "We'll not compromise on our product quality at any cost." Earlier, six dairy farmers were arrested for injecting buffaloes with oxytocin to increase their milk-producing capacity.

93.title: Army jawan trying to board Rajdhani Express at UP station pushed by TTE, loses a leg
93.article_body: An Army jawan trying to board Rajdhani Express at the Bareilly Junction in Uttar Pradesh lost his leg after being pushed by TTE. As per reports, the train had just started running when the incident happened. The jawan also sustained injuries in his other leg. Following the incident, fellow Army jawans stopped the train and reportedly beat up the TTE.

94.title: Man jumps from 6th floor of Mantralaya building in Mumbai, lands on safety net
94.article_body: A man jumped from sixth floor of Mantralaya building, which acts as the administrative headquarters of Maharashtra government, in Mumbai. A video surfaced online showing the man speaking after landing on safety net, which has been installed to foil suicide attempts after similar incidents in the past. The man was reportedly unhappy with police probe related to his lover's death.

95.title: AAP leader Jagmal Vala slaps toll plaza worker in Guj; video surfaces
95.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's candidate from Gujarat's Somnath constituency, Jagmal Vala, slapped an employee at the Dari toll plaza near Veraval on Wednesday night. A CCTV footage of the incident that surfaced online showed Vala coming out of his car and slapping the toll worker before getting into a scuffle and creating a ruckus. An FIR has been registered against him.

96.title: Gang issuing fake arms licences busted in Hyd; 7 held, firearms seized
96.article_body: The Hyderabad Police busted an interstate gang issuing fake weapons licences and arrested seven persons in the case. The police seized 30 single-bore and three double-bore weapons, a revolver, 34 fake weapon licence books and nine weapon licences with fake stamps. Police Commissioner CV Anand said the circulation of illegal weapons poses danger to the city's peace and security.

97.title: Which are the world's most common passwords of 2022?
97.article_body: The password 'password' is not only the most common password used in India, but it's also the most common password used worldwide in 2022, password manager NordPass said. '123456' is the second-most common password used globally, followed by '123456789', 'guest', 'qwerty', '12345678', '111111', '12345', 'col123456', and '123123'. Hackers take less than a second to crack 8 of these 10 passwords.

98.title: World's 3rd richest man Adani plans to open family office in Dubai or New York: Report
98.article_body: The world's third-richest man Gautam Adani is considering setting up a family office in Dubai or New York to manage his wealth, Bloomberg reported. It will invest the Adani family's personal funds and Adani Group's founders are looking to hire a full suite of specialised family office managers. This comes amid a $58 billion surge in Adani's wealth this year.

99.title: Delhi hospitals to have pollution clinics to fight air-related illness
99.article_body: Delhi government will introduce pollution clinics at all major hospitals for patients with air-pollution-related illnesses starting in December, health department officials said. "Staff will be trained and resources will be set aside for cases where the cause of disease or allergies can be traced," an official said. The clinics will first start at Lok Nayak and Guru Teg Bahadur hospitals.

100.title: Man claims 1,000 people stand in queue at Pune airport, shares pic
100.article_body: A man named Sudipta Ghosh took to Twitter on Tuesday and complained of a long queue at the Pune airport. "Minimum 1,000 people ahead in the queue for security check at Pune airport...Travelling with my mother who's above 60 makes it more difficult," he tweeted. He also shared a picture wherein several people can be seen standing in the queue.

101.title: Paid ₹1 lakh to B'luru Police: Social media post accuses police of harassment
101.article_body: A social media post detailing an alleged incident of harassment by Bengaluru Police has surfaced. The post titled 'Paid 1L to Bangalore police to let us go' narrates the alleged ordeal of an unidentified individual who was taken to a police station in Bengaluru for using an e-cigarette, which is banned in India. The user accused police of demanding bribe.

102.title: But this year I'm superstar: Kher on SRK's 'last of the superstars' comment
102.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher has opened up about Shah Rukh Khan's 'I'm the last of the superstars' comment that he had made on 'The Anupam Kher Show'. "It was a very charming statement Shah Rukh made, but this year the superstar is Anupam Kher," he said referring to his successful films like 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Karthikeya 2' in 2022.

103.title: 'Love jihad' cases must have stricter punishment: BJP MLA urges UP CM
103.article_body: BJP MLA Rajeshwar Singh, on Thursday, urged UP CM Yogi Adityanath to amend state laws dealing with heinous crimes and proposed stricter punishment for 'love jihad' cases. In his six-page letter to the CM, Singh highlighted Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner and asked for a fast-track approach when dealing with such cases.

104.title: Rapido bike rider did not harass Bengaluru model: Police
104.article_body: The allegations of sexual harassment made by a 21-year-old Bengaluru model against a Rapido bike rider are false, police said. The model had lodged a complaint against Rapido and the rider, Manjunath Tippeswamy. DCP, East, Bhimashankar Guled said the woman had cancelled the ride and that there was no evidence to show the rider had gone to the spot.

105.title: What is the water bell concept that will be reintroduced in schools in Karnataka?
105.article_body: Karnataka School Education Minister BC Nagesh said he has instructed officials to reintroduce the 'water bell' concept in schools across the state. A bell would ring thrice on a regular school day and whenever it rings, children would be encouraged to drink water. The concept was first introduced in schools in Karnataka in 2019 following its success in Kerala.

106.title: Court rejects masjid's plea over suit maintainability in Gyanvapi case
106.article_body: A Varanasi court on Thursday dismissed Anjuman Islamia Masjid committee's plea challenging the maintainability of the suit in the Gyanvapi Mosque case. The suit, filed by Lord Vishweshwar Virajman (Swayambhu), seeks to hand over the possession of the mosque premises to the Hindu side. The Muslim side can offer prayers in the mosque till the matter is in court.

107.title: 22-yr-old soldier dies after being hit by public bus in Bengaluru
107.article_body: A 22-year-old soldier attached to the Madras Regiment succumbed to injuries on Thursday after he was hit by a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus on November 7. The deceased was identified as Chetan, a resident of Chinnakote village in Kolar district. Chetan had gone to Bengaluru to meet his family. He was hit by the bus in Kamakshipalya area.

108.title: 6-time MLA Niranjan Patel quits Congress after being denied ticket in Gujarat polls
108.article_body: Petlad MLA Niranjan Patel has resigned both from the Assembly and Congress party after being denied a ticket in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. Congress dropped the 74-year-old and fielded Dr Prakash Parmar from the Petlad seat. Patel, however, didn't ascribe the reason for his decision in the resignation letter. Patel has won the Petlad seat six times since 1990.

109.title: Who is Sandhya Devanathan, Meta's new India head?
109.article_body: Facebook's parent company Meta appointed Sandhya Devanathan as the new Head and Vice President of its India business. Devanathan did her B.Tech from Andhra University, MBA from the Faculty of Management Studies - University of Delhi, and attended Oxford University's Saïd Business School for leadership. Prior to joining Meta in 2020, she worked at Citi and Standard Chartered Bank.

110.title: Hyd policeman held for assaulting neighbour, threatening to upload her pics
110.article_body: A policeman has been arrested in Hyderabad for sexually assaulting and threatening his female neighbour. In 2021, she complained against him, which led to his suspension. In August, he went to her house and threatened to upload pictures and videos on social media and allegedly assaulted her, police said. On November 14, he tried to molest her again, police added.

111.title: Alstom wins ₹2,643 crore order to supply 312 coaches for Delhi Metro
111.article_body: French company Alstom has won a €312 million (around ₹2,643 crore) order to design and manufacture 312 metro cars for Delhi Metro Phase IV. The order consists of 234 standard gauge metro cars for Line 7 extension (Pink Line 12.558 km) on the Mukundpur-Maujpur corridor and the Line 8 extension (Magenta Line 28.92 km) for the Janakpuri West-RK Ashram corridor.

112.title: ICAI looking into BYJU'S financial disclosures: President Debashis Mitra
112.article_body: Institute of Chartered Accountants of India President Debashis Mitra said the body is looking into the financial disclosures made by BYJU'S amid concerns that there are issues related to them. He added that the Financial Reporting Review Board is also looking into the matter. MP Karti Chidambaram had written to the ICAI last month alleging issues for the 2020-21 period.

113.title: Ex-ambassador Abasar Beuria passes away after cardiac arrest at 80
113.article_body: Former Indian ambassador and noted Odiya litterateur Abasar Beuria passed away on Thursday following a cardiac arrest. The 80-year-old died at a hospital in Bhubaneswar. He had served in Indian diplomatic missions in Japan, Russia (formerly USSR), America, the UAE, Myanmar, Sri Lanka and Madagascar. President Droupadi Murmu, who had met the former diplomat earlier this month, condoled his demise.

114.title: Police custody of Aftab Poonawala extended by 5 days, narco-analysis test allowed
114.article_body: A Delhi court on Thursday extended the police custody of Aftab Poonawala, who is accused of murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar, by five days. The court also gave permission to police seeking a narco-analysis test of the accused. The Delhi Police will take Aftab to Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh, among other places, for investigation during the extension of custody.

115.title: Soren has become symbol of corruption in state: Jharkhand BJP chief
115.article_body: Jharkhand BJP chief Deepak Prakash on Thursday alleged that CM Hemant Soren has become a symbol of corruption in the state. "You can see the dark deeds of corruption prevailing in the...government every day," Prakash said, adding many government officers are involved in the illegal mining case. Prakash's comment came after Soren appeared before ED for questioning in the case.

116.title: Retired BPCL chairman Arun Kumar Singh likely to be next ONGC head
116.article_body: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Ltd's former chairman Arun Kumar Singh is likely to be the new chairman of ONGC. Singh retired after attaining the superannuation age last month and was already selected to head the Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board. Singh will get a tenure of three years if his selection is approved.

117.title: 'India Lockdown' is my tribute to Smita Patil & her work: Prateik
117.article_body: Actor Prateik Babbar, who plays a migrant worker in 'India Lockdown', said his role in the film is a tribute to his mother Smita Patil and her "body of work". "Once sir (director Madhur Bhandarkar) mentioned that 'Tere maa ne aise kirdaar nibhaye hai. Yeh waisa hi hai (Your mother has played similar characters)', I was all in," he shared.

118.title: 30 tonnes of smuggled PDS rice seized in Telangana's Siddipet, 2 held
118.article_body: Police on Thursday seized 30 tonnes of Public Distribution System (PDS) rice while it was being smuggled in Telangana's Siddipet and arrested two persons. Town inspector and Task Force along with their teams were checking vehicles when they found two persons ferrying PDS rice in a lorry and an auto. The drivers, Mote Raju and Jakkula Anil, hail from Siddipet.

119.title: 'Ban remote work,' advises Unacademy CEO to founders in post; Twitter users react
119.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal took to Twitter to share a piece of advice that he gives to early-stage founders. Munjal wrote, "Ban remote work in...organisation and call everyone back to the office…In almost every case I get a message…later saying that this advice was game-changing for their organisation." A Twitter user reacted, "Basically, you want everyone under your eyes."

120.title: 'Aftab ko phaansi do', say lawyers in Saket court; video surfaces
120.article_body: A video has surfaced, which shows lawyers in Delhi's Saket court demanding a death penalty for Aftab Poonawala, who's accused of killing Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces. Citing security reasons and sensing the sensitivity of the case, Aftab was produced before a Delhi court virtually at 4 pm on Thursday.

121.title: T'gana govt sanctions ₹1,571 cr for development of NIMS in Hyderabad
121.article_body: The Telangana government on Wednesday approved an administrative sanction of ₹1,571 crore for the development of Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences (NIMS) in Hyderabad. The money will fund the construction of a new block and add 2,000 super speciality beds with internal oxygen supply. State Health Minister T Harish Rao tweeted, saying the move is another step towards 'Arogya Telangana'.

122.title: 7 suspected measles deaths, 164 cases reported since Sept: BMC
122.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday said that seven suspected measles deaths and 164 cases were reported in Mumbai since September. Out of the 1,263 suspected measles cases, 647 cases include children in the age group of one to four years, BMC said in a release. The highest number of cases are from Govandi and surrounding areas, BMC added.

123.title: If you don't self-regulate, govt will have to: Piyush Goyal to OTT
123.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has asked the entertainment industry, especially OTT and television, to "self-regulate" and bring "decency" in its content as he believes some of it is "beyond" Indian culture's "acceptable standards". "If you don't...government will have to regulate," he said. He also wondered if Indian families use the kind of language that's used in some of the shows.

124.title: French firm Alstom wins order to design 312 metro cars for Delhi Metro
124.article_body: The Delhi Metro has awarded France-based company Alstom an order worth 312 million euros to design and manufacture a total of 312 metro cars for Delhi Metro Phase-IV. Alstom said it has delivered more than 800 metro cars that are in service for the Delhi Metro network. The new trains will be built at Alstom's manufacturing site in Andhra Pradesh.

125.title: Mehul Choksi sends legal notice to 'File No 323' makers, producers react
125.article_body: PNB scam accused Mehul Choksi has sent a cease and desist notice to the makers of 'File No 323' film starring Anurag Kashyap and Suniel Shetty, alleging that reports about the movie are tarnishing his image. The film's producers Kalol Das and Parth Rawal said, "Our film is going to present well-researched facts and information about economic offenders."

126.title: Such incidents happen with educated, frank girls: Kaushal Kishore on Shraddha murder case
126.article_body: Reacting to a woman named Shraddha Walkar getting murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Amin Poonawala, Union Minister Kaushal Kishore said, "These incidents happen with educated girls, who call themselves frank." "Shraddha's parents were against her live-in relationship, then why was she still in a live-in relationship?" he asked. He further said that live-in relationships should be banned.

127.title: FTX case raised allegations of potential fraud: Singapore Deputy PM
127.article_body: Singapore's Finance Minister and Deputy PM Lawrence Wong has said that collapse of crypto exchange FTX has raised "very serious allegations that amount to potential fraud". Wong added that the city-state is "on the right track" in focusing on digital assets innovation. At least $1 billion of client funds are reportedly missing at FTX. The firm recently filed for bankruptcy.

128.title: Savarkar helped British & betrayed Mahatma Gandhi, Nehru: Rahul Gandhi
128.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said that Vinayak Damodar Savarkar helped the British. Gandhi shared a letter, claiming it was written by Savarkar to the British, and said, "[In the letter] Savarkar has stated 'I beg to remain, sir, your most obedient servant'." "Savarkar betrayed leaders like Mahatma Gandhi [and] Jawaharlal Nehru...by signing the letter out of fear," he added.

129.title: PM protecting CEO of Oreva Group that operated Morbi bridge: Congress
129.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh on Thursday said that the CEO of Oreva Group, which operated the Morbi bridge, was not being arrested because he had PM Narendra Modi's "protection". Responding to the Gujarat HC's observation on the Morbi tragedy, Singh said that it shows how "criminalisation, corruption and commission" are widespread under PM Modi's rule.

130.title: Realty tycoon Niranjan Hiranandani invests in Tata-backed Goodfellows
130.article_body: Real estate tycoon Niranjan Hiranandani has invested in Goodfellows, a startup founded by Shantanu Naidu, which offers companionship as a service to senior citizens. Shradha Sharma, the Founder and CEO of YourStory, has also invested in the Ratan Tata-backed company. Hiranandani and Sharma will also be on the company's advisory board. Notably, Naidu is a General Manager in Tata's office.

131.title: Which are the most common passwords used in India in 2022?
131.article_body: The password 'password' is India's most commonly used password of 2022, with hackers taking less than 1 second to crack it, according to research by password manager NordPass. '123456' is the second-most common password, followed by '12345678', 'bigbasket', '123456789', 'pass@123', '1234567890', 'anmol123', 'abcd1234' and 'googledummy'. NordPass evaluated a 3TB database for the research.

132.title: 'Freddy' is a dark thriller that's been missing for a while: Kartik
132.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said that his upcoming film 'Freddy' is "different", "gripping" and a kind of dark thriller "that's been missing for a while" from the Hindi film industry. The actor called 'Freddy' a "special film", which made him challenge his abilities as an actor. Describing his role, Kartik said he doesn't play a "conventional Bollywood hero" in the film.

133.title: Binance to relaunch bid to buy bankrupt crypto firm Voyager: Report
133.article_body: Crypto exchange Binance's US unit is relaunching its bid to buy bankrupt crypto lender Voyager Digital, Coindesk reported citing sources. The report comes after Voyager called off FTX's $1.42-billion bid to acquire the company following its collapse. Voyager on Thursday said it has reopened the bidding process for the company and is in active discussions with alternative bidders.

134.title: 70-year-old man found hanging at Bihar police station, SHO suspended
134.article_body: A 70-year-old man, arrested in Bihar following a scuffle, was found hanging from a ceiling fan in one of the rooms of Koran Sarai police station under "mysterious circumstances" on Thursday. Following the incident, SHO Junaid Alam has been suspended, a police official said. Meanwhile, locals, on finding out about the matter, took to the streets in protest.

135.title: Ex-Mumbai officer arrested for pocketing ₹1 cr meant for tribal students
135.article_body: A retired project officer, who was attached to Tribal Development Authority in Mumbai's Borivali East, was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly embezzling over ₹1 crore between 2004 and 2009. The money had been disbursed by the authority to provide scholarships to tribal students. Mahadeo Vadu was arrested from Palghar district. His successor had filed an FIR against him in 2020.

136.title: Owner fined ₹10,000 after dog bites 6-yr-old in Gr Noida society lift
136.article_body: The owner of the dog, which attacked a six-year-old boy in the lift of a housing society in Greater Noida, has been fined ₹10,000 by the Greater Noida Authority. The video of the incident showing the dog grabbing the boy's hand inside the lift surfaced online on Tuesday. The boy's family later reported the matter to the police.

137.title: Sex racket operating in B'luru busted, secret room to hide women found
137.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) officials busted a sex racket operating in three hotels in Bengaluru. During the raid, the officials also unearthed a secret room in one of the hotels, which was allegedly being used to hide women, reports said. Police have arrested three people connected with the racket and seven women have been rescued.

138.title: We're suffering because movies are failing: Maratha Mandir Executive
138.article_body: Manoj Desai, who is the Executive Director of G7 multiplex and Maratha Mandir Cinema, has said he will continue to cut movie ticket prices if it results in more people coming to watch films. "We are suffering because movies are failing...[distributors] said, 'If you won't increase the ticket prices, we won't give you the movies'," he added.

139.title: Superficial perception that Cong not putting up fight against BJP: Rahul
139.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said a superficial perception has been created that Congress is not putting up a fight against BJP. "Opposition has no control over institutions, judiciary and media," Rahul said while addressing a press conference. "I see two big problems, youths don't have assurance of getting jobs and farmers don't get support from anywhere," he added.

140.title: Only women to walk with Rahul during Bharat Jodo Yatra on Indira Jayanti: Jairam
140.article_body: On the occasion of Indira Gandhi Jayanti, on November 19, only women will walk with Congress leader Rahul Gandhi during the Bharat Jodo Yatra, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh said. As per the official schedule of the yatra, on November 19, it will begin from Shegaon in Buldhana district and would end at Bhendval, Jalgaon Jamod in Buldhana district of Maharashtra.

141.title: 3 killed after bus hits motorcycle in Chhattisgarh's Durg
141.article_body: Three persons were killed after a passenger bus hit their motorcycle in Chhattisgarh's Durg district, said police. The victims, aged 30, 40 and 45, died on the spot. Angered by the incident, locals ransacked the bus, while the driver fled from the spot. The police said they rushed to the spot and brought the situation under control.

142.title: Railways to build 1,000-km boundary walls amid rise in cattle deaths
142.article_body: Railways is planning to construct 1,000-km-long boundary walls along railway tracks over next five or six months, Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. The decision comes after around 2,650 cattle deaths on tracks reported across the country since April 1 this year. Cattle hits on tracks affected 200 trains in the first nine days of October including the Vande Bharat Express.

143.title: Aftab to be produced before court virtually due to security reasons
143.article_body: Aftab Poonawala, who's accused of killing Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, will be produced before a court virtually because of security reasons and the sensitivity of the case. Aftab burnt Shraddha's face to conceal her identity, reports said, adding that he also learnt how to hide the dead body on the internet.

144.title: PMC to prepare detailed project report to resolve waterlogging
144.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) will prepare a detailed project report to resolve the issue of waterlogging in the city this year. "Heavy rain has led to stagnation of water in new places and we want to take up a technical study...and carry out...remedial measures accordingly," a PMC officer said. PMC is "working hard" to resolve the issue, the officer added.

145.title: Was mocked for my teeth, got 'Taare...' because of them: Darsheel
145.article_body: Actor Darsheel Safary has said that he has faced jokes on him because of his height and his teeth in his personal life. "My teeth were like one kilometre out. It all happens for a reason. All that happened and then I got 'Taare Zameen Par' because of those teeth," he added. Darsheel stated he was an "extraordinarily sensitive child".

146.title: Leniency in dealing with juveniles is emboldening them: SC
146.article_body: Supreme Court on Wednesday said that it is gathering the impression that dealing with juvenile offenders with leniency in the name of reformation is emboldening them to indulge in heinous crimes. The remark was made after the apex court ruled that an accused in 2018 rape and murder of an eight-year-old girl in Kathua will be tried as an adult.

147.title: Iran made 10 attempts to kidnap or kill UK-linked individuals: UK spy chief
147.article_body: Britain's Director General of the Security Service Ken McCallum has said Iranian intelligence services have made at least 10 attempts to kidnap or kill British nationals or UK-based individuals considered as threat. McCallum called Iranian intelligence services "a sophisticated adversary". Last week, UK summoned Iranian envoy over alleged threats by Iranian security forces to journalists in UK.

148.title: Govt approves ₹2,500-₹4,000 salary hike for 80,000 Railways staff
148.article_body: Nearly 80,000 Indian Railways employees can expect a salary hike between ₹2,500-₹4,000 as the government has cleared the proposal. The hikes will allow employees facing job stagnation to get salary equivalent to Group A officers. Railway Board Chairman VK Tripathi said this will not result in any additional financial burden and called the proposal for the same "financially neutral".

149.title: Elon Musk has identified potential successor as CEO: Tesla executive
149.article_body: Tesla executive James Murdoch said CEO Elon Musk has identified a potential successor to head electric carmaker. Musk is facing a trial over his $56-billion Tesla salary. Murdoch was testifying in the trial and when asked to confirm that Musk never identified someone as a potential successor, Murdoch said, "He actually has" and that happened in the "last few months".

150.title: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari falls ill on stage after an event in West Bengal
150.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Thursday fell ill on stage after attending an event in West Bengal's Siliguri. "After the programme ended...Gadkari ji complained of uneasiness. The doctors immediately attended to him in...backstage area," BJP MLA Neeraj Zimba said. According to officials, he was taken to residence of Darjeeling MP Raju Bista, who was also present at the programme.

151.title: Drunk men kill 19-yr-old waiter over rice in mutton soup in Pune
151.article_body: A 19-year-old waiter, working at a hotel in Pune, was killed by two drunk men over rice in mutton soup, police said on Wednesday. Two other employees of the hotel were injured in the incident, which took place late on Tuesday night. The accused hit the deceased on his head, said assistant police inspector Dilip Pawar.

152.title: MS Dhoni wins doubles event in tennis tournament in Jharkhand, pic surfaces
152.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni won the doubles event along with his partner Sumeet Kumar Bajaj at the Jharkhand State Cricket Association (JSCA) Tennis Championship 2022. The event was held in Ranchi. Reacting to a picture of Dhoni collecting the trophy, a fan tweeted, "MSD's hobbies- Bike collections and Trophy collections." Another wrote, "Winning everywhere."

153.title: Rahul asks for national song, Congress plays Nepal's national anthem; video surfaces
153.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Congress leader Rahul Gandhi ordering to play the national song at the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra but the party instead played the national anthem of Nepal. The Congress later played the 'Bharoto Bhagyo Bidhata' song and party leaders including Gandhi were seen surprised after the first stanza, which is the national anthem, ended.

154.title: Delhi Police to match Shraddha's DNA with chopped head found in June
154.article_body: Police will match Shraddha's DNA with a chopped head that was found in June in Delhi's Trilokpuri area. According to reports, the police had found a head and a hand, but couldn't ascertain whose body parts they were because of their tampered state. Aftab Poonawala told the police that he burnt Shraddha's face to conceal her identity.

155.title: 'Chandigarh…' didn't do well because our country is homophobic: Ayushmann
155.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said that his film 'Chandigarh Kare Aashiqui' didn't do commercially well because "our country is homophobic". He added that his film 'Anek' also didn't perform well because it was a "very niche" subject. The actor further added that "regardless of success or failure", he'd continue to take risks and be unconventional in his script choices.

156.title: Had kiss with Sunny Deol in Dacait, but censors cut it: Meenakshi Sheshadri
156.article_body: Actress Meenakshi Sheshadri revealed that she had a kissing scene with actor Sunny Deol in the film 'Dacait', however, the scene was cut by the censors. "I give full credit to Sunny for being very professional about it and making me comfortable too," she added. The 1987 film also featured Raakhee, Suresh Oberoi, Paresh Rawal and Urmila Matondkar.

157.title: Hyd doctors remove 10-kg 'football-sized' kidney tumour from man's body
157.article_body: Doctors at Hyderabad's Asian Institute of Nephrology and Urology have removed a football-sized kidney tumour weighing 10 kg from a 53-year-old man's body. Doctors said there was swelling in the patient's abdomen and tumour was arising from left kidney. They said a microscopic examination confirmed that the tumour was a cancerous growth, adding that the cancer-affected kidney has been removed.

158.title: Russia blocks access to website of Novaya Gazeta newspaper
158.article_body: Russia has blocked access to the website of independent publication Novaya Gazeta. In March, Novaya Gazeta suspended print and online publication amid new censorship laws introduced after Russian invasion of Ukraine. Novaya Gazeta's editor Dmitry Muratov was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2021 for defending press freedom. In September, Russian courts revoked Novaya Gazeta's media license.

159.title: FDA detects adulteration in 27% cooking oil from 4 Thane firms
159.article_body: At least 27 per cent of 56 samples of cooking oil and other food items collected from four Thane-based companies have been found adulterated or with false claims, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) said. FDA found that palmolein oil was mixed in products like sunflower and soybean oils, and rice bran oil was mixed in mustard oil.

160.title: BEST to felicitate bus driver who rescued Mumbai woman from leopard
160.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) will felicitate a bus driver who recently saved a 38-year-old woman from a leopard in Mumbai's Aarey Milk Colony. Dipesh Sunil Awade was ferrying passengers on Friday night when he spotted the animal attacking Sarita Gurav. He scared off the leopard by honking incessantly. Thereafter, Awade helped the injured woman board his bus.

161.title: There were no police at the time of Morbi bridge collapse: Digvijaya
161.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh, while speaking about the Morbi bridge collapse incident, said when he reached the spot he got to know there were no police or even a constable at the time of the incident. "A BJP meeting was being held 4 km away, it takes 10 minutes to reach there...meeting went on for an hour post-accident," he added.

162.title: Producer denies Ektaa being upset with Kartik over Freddy's OTT release
162.article_body: 'Freddy' producer Jay Shewakramani has denied reports of producer Ektaa Kapoor being upset with actor Kartik Aaryan over the film's OTT release. He stated, "'Freddy' has been designed for OTT from day one. We never planned to bring it on a big screen." Jay added that working with Kartik was like a "dream" and called him a "thorough professional".

163.title: Traffic restrictions in parts of Hyderabad till Feb 16 for SNDP works
163.article_body: The Hyderabad Police announced traffic restrictions in parts of the city ahead of the commencement of the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) phase two works for three months starting from November 18, 2022, to February 16, 2023. The traffic restrictions will be in place for the construction of the nala between Rasoolpura to Ramgopalpet PS on Minister Road, Begumpet.

164.title: Blizzard to suspend most games in China as NetEase deal set to end
164.article_body: California-based video game developer Blizzard Entertainment on Wednesday announced that it will suspend most of its games including 'World of Warcraft' and 'Hearthstone' in China. The suspension will come after a 14-year-old deal with Chinese gaming firm NetEase ends on January 23. Blizzard said the companies have been unable to reach an agreement to renew the deal.

165.title: 2024 polls will be my last if not voted to power: Chandrababu Naidu
165.article_body: TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday said that the 2024 Andhra Pradesh Assembly elections would be his last if his party is not voted to power. Speaking at a roadshow in Kurnool district, Naidu said, "I will only set things right and put the state back on the track of progress and hand over the future to others."

166.title: Berkshire's Munger calls Tesla's success 'minor miracle'; Musk responds
166.article_body: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice Chairman Charlie Munger told CNBC what Tesla did in the car business is a "minor miracle". "We haven't had a successful new auto company in a long, long time," he said, adding that Tesla CEO Elon Musk "has done some good things that others couldn't do". Responding to this, Musk said, "Mr Munger's words are much appreciated."

167.title: Musk admits to making some decisions without Tesla board's approval
167.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday admitted to making some decisions related to the company without the approval of the board of directors. He said certain decisions, including ending Tesla's acceptance of Bitcoin, he took unilaterally. Musk was speaking in a trial to defend his $56 billion pay package against allegations that he dictated its terms to a compliant board.

168.title: Congress claims K'taka CM responsible for corrupt electoral practice
168.article_body: Congress' Karnataka unit has alleged that CM Basavaraj Bommai is responsible for a corrupt electoral practice, wherein a private agency collected voter data, and sought his resignation. Bengaluru civic body authorised the agency to conduct a voters' survey and data collected was uploaded on a private firm's application instead of government's application, party leader Randeep Surjewala claimed.

169.title: Won't participate in Golden Globes, not a hypocrite: Brendan Fraser
169.article_body: Brendan Fraser has said that he'll "not participate" in the 80th Golden Globes' ceremony if he's nominated for 'The Whale' because of his history with Hollywood Foreign Press Association (organisation behind Golden Globes). "It's because of the history...my mother didn't raise a hypocrite," he commented. In 2018, Brendan shared that he was groped by the association's former president Philip Berk.

170.title: Ukraine probing 63 bodies found with signs of torture in Kherson: Report
170.article_body: Investigators in Ukraine's Kherson have uncovered 63 bodies with signs of torture after Russian forces left the area, a news agency reported citing Ukraine's Interior Minister Denys Monastyrsky. "Investigators are...examining them and setting down every instance of torture," Monastyrsky said. He added that law enforcement bodies had uncovered 436 instances of war crimes during Russian occupation.

171.title: Leopard enters house in Maha while family was having dinner, runs away as they scream
171.article_body: A leopard entered a house in Maharashtra's Junnar while the family was having dinner. As per Vilas Raykar, the owner of the house, the leopard got inside their house while chasing a cat. He stated that as soon as they saw the leopard, they started screaming, adding that the leopard left the house on hearing them screaming.

172.title: We love Savarkar, don't agree with Rahul Gandhi's remarks: Uddhav
172.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said that he does not agree with Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's remarks on VD Savarkar. "We respect and love Savarkar," he said.
