This comes after Gandhi during Bharat Jodo Yatra said that Savarkar is a symbol of BJP and RSS. "[Savarkar] used to take pension from the British, work for them," Gandhi added.

173.title: Fire breaks out in Pune apartment, 2 students rescued
173.article_body: A fire broke out in a three-storey building in Pune's Kothrud area on Thursday morning, a fire brigade official said. The incident took place in an apartment located on the second floor of Prabha Cooperative Housing Society building. As per the official, two students residing in the apartment were rescued, while one of them suffered a minor burn injury.

174.title: Satyendra Jain denied bail by Delhi court in money laundering case
174.article_body: A Delhi Court on Thursday denied bail to AAP leader Satyendar Jain and two other co-accused in a money laundering case. Special Judge Vikas Dhull was scheduled to pronounce the order on Wednesday, but he'd adjourned the matter as the order wasn't ready. Jain had sought bail, stating there was no purpose in keeping him in custody any longer.

175.title: Filing for bankruptcy was my biggest single fu**up: FTX ex-CEO Sam
175.article_body: Speaking to a Vox journalist on Twitter DMs, former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried said filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy was his "biggest single fu**up". He added, those in charge of FTX's bankruptcy process are "trying to burn it all to the ground out of shame" and if he hadn't done it, "everything would be (approximately) 70% fixed right now".

176.title: Delhi man forges letter in Minister's name for Gurugram job; booked
176.article_body: A Delhi man was booked for allegedly forging a recommendation letter bearing the name and letterhead of a Union Minister to get a job in a construction company in Gurugram, police said on Wednesday. According to the complainant, the accused had handed over several documents during his interview, one of which was forged.

177.title: Man posing as alms-seeker attacks TDP leader with sickle in Andhra; video surfaces
177.article_body: A man posing as an alms-seeker attacked P Seshagiri Rao, leader of the opposition Telugu Desam Party in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada district on Thursday. The CCTV footage of the incident that surfaced online shows the man abruptly pulling out a sickle and attacking Rao while snatching alms from his hands. Rao reportedly sustained grievous injuries to his head and hands.

178.title: 1-yr-old critical after family turns to home remedies for measles in Mumbai
178.article_body: One-year-old Rayesh Gupta was admitted to Mumbai's Kasturba Hospital in critical condition around 13 days after he developed fever and red rashes all over his body. His father said the family turned to traditional home remedies, ate vegetarian food and fanned him with neem leaves. Sticking to religious practices, they also offered food to a deity until his condition deteriorated.

179.title: Won't back Trump in Presidential Election 2024: Blackstone CEO
179.article_body: Blackstone CEO Stephen Schwarzman, one of Wall Street's biggest donors to former US President Donald Trump's election campaigns, has said that he will not back Trump in 2024 election. "It is time for the Republican Party to turn to a new generation of leaders," Schwarzman said. Schwarzman reportedly spent $35.5 million to support Republicans ahead of last week's midterm election.

180.title: Govt responds as reports claim Bharat Biotech rushed Covaxin trial under pressure
180.article_body: The Centre on Thursday said that reports claiming that Bharat Biotech "had to skip certain processes" and "speed" up clinical trials of its COVID-19 vaccine Covaxin due to political pressure are misleading and fallacious. The government said that scientific approach and prescribed norms were followed in approving COVID-19 vaccines after reports claimed there were irregularities in clinical trials.

181.title: Aftab told police he burned Shraddha's face to conceal her identity: Report
181.article_body: Aftab Amin Poonawala told police that after killing his partner Shraddha Walkar, he burnt her face to conceal her identity, according to an ANI report quoting police sources. "During the interrogation, Aftab revealed that he had learnt about all this on the internet, and also about how to hide the body from everyone's reach," the sources said.

182.title: Russia becomes India's 5th-largest trade partner, up from 25th spot: Report
182.article_body: Driven by a surge in oil and fertiliser imports, Russia has emerged as India's fifth-largest trading partner during the April-September period, up from the 25th position at the end of FY22, ToI cited official data. US and China have retained the top two positions. Trade deficit with Moscow is pegged at over $20 billion during the first half of FY23.

183.title: Actress Riya Sen joins Rahul Gandhi for Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra
183.article_body: Actress Riya Sen on Thursday joined Congress party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra led by Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtra’s Akola. "Now the roads are witnessing revolution," Congress tweeted while sharing Sen’s pictures during the yatra. The party leaders resumed the Maharashtra leg of yatra today from Patur. Earlier, actress Pooja Bhatt also joined Rahul Gandhi for the yatra in Hyderabad.

184.title: NCB seizes drugs worth ₹1 crore in a week in Mumbai, 4 arrested
184.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) seized drugs, including some concealed in photo frames which were to be smuggled to Doha, worth ₹1 crore in different operations in Mumbai in a week, an official said. Four persons were arrested. The seized drugs include 19 kilograms of ganja, 1.15 kg of hydroponic weed, 13,500 Nitrazepam tablets and 3,840 Tramadol tablets, he added.

185.title: Bridge shouldn't have been opened: Morbi civic body to Gujarat HC
185.article_body: Gujarat's Morbi civic body has taken responsibility for the bridge collapse tragedy, which left over 130 people dead, a document shows. In an affidavit, the city's civic body stated before the High Court that the bridge "shouldn't have been opened". This comes after the court told it to reply by evening or pay costs of ₹1 lakh on Wednesday.

186.title: Income Tax Dept raids Bihar minister Samir Kumar Mahaseth's office, residence
186.article_body: Income Tax Department is conducting a raid at the office and residence of the Bihar Minister of Industries Samir Kumar Mahaseth in Patna. A team of 25 officials of the department are conducting the raid. The promoter of Saakaar group, who is a relative of a Bihar minister, and other top executives are also being searched, ANI reported citing sources.

187.title: EC rejects over 43% nominations for MCD polls, scrutiny continues
187.article_body: The State Election Commission rejected 1,115 nominations (43.13%) filed for the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) elections scheduled on December 4, 2022. The scrutiny continued till 10 pm on Wednesday and pending applications were being taken up on Thursday, an official said. The rejected papers were either incomplete or did not have the required proposers count, another official said.

188.title: Vijay Deverakonda promises to donate his organs, says 'My mother and I have registered'
188.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda attended an event to encourage organ donation and promised to donate his organs. "I think I'll donate all my organs...I don't see any point in wasting my organs...My mother and I have registered to donate," he said. "I'd love for it to be part of someone after me and help them in their life," he added.

189.title: Meta appoints Sandhya Devanathan as Head and VP of its India business
189.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has appointed Sandhya Devanathan as the new Head and Vice President of its India business after Ajit Mohan's exit. According to Meta, Devanathan joined the company in 2016 and helped in building its Singapore and Vietnam businesses. Notably, WhatsApp India head Abhijit Bose and Meta India's Director of Public Policy Rajiv Aggarwal also recently left the company.

190.title: 17-yr-old raped by father, grandfather, uncle for 6 years in Pune
190.article_body: An investigation has been launched by the Pune police after a 17-year-old girl said she was raped and sexually abused multiple times by her father, grandfather and uncle over the past six years. She made the revelation before a committee on sexual harassment at her college in the city. Her 49-year-old father has been arrested.

191.title: Jharkhand CM arrives at ED office to appear in illegal mining case
191.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday arrived at Enforcement Directorate (ED) office in Ranchi after he was summoned to appear before it in the illegal mining case. Soren had addressed the media before leaving for the ED office and said, "The way I'm being summoned...feels like I'll be fleeing...country." Earlier, Supreme Court had allowed Soren to challenge cases against him.

192.title: Women's wing of Shiv Sena's Uddhav faction demands ban on dating apps
192.article_body: The women's wing of Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray faction held a protest in Maharashtra's Vasai, calling for a ban on dating apps after the Shraddha Walkar murder case in New Delhi. Shraddha's decision of not listening to her parents and choosing to stay with boyfriend is shocking and expresses mentality of youth today, which we condemn, former Vasai-Virar corporator said.

193.title: Infosys to give 65% variable pay for Q2 with Nov's salary: Report
193.article_body: Infosys will pay its employees 65% variable pay for the second quarter after slashing their variable pay by 30% in the previous quarter, The Economic Times reported. The variable pay will be given to all eligible employees in the November payroll cycle. Employees working in the US and Canada will get the pay alongside the second biweekly November payroll.

194.title: Note-taking app Evernote to be acquired by app maker Bending Spoons
194.article_body: Note-taking and task management app Evernote has announced that it is set to be acquired by Milan-based app developer Bending Spoons. While the terms of the acquisition weren't made public, Evernote CEO Ian Small said the transaction is expected to close in early 2023. Bending Spoons is behind mobile apps like the video editor Splice and image editing tool Remini.

195.title: Documentary announced on 'Rust' cinematographer accidentally shot by Alec
195.article_body: A feature-length documentary on cinematographer Halyna Hutchins has been announced. Hutchins was accidentally killed in an incident involving a prop gun fired by actor-producer Alec Baldwin during the shoot of their film 'Rust' in October 2021. The documentary will explore Hutchins' life and work, and has been fully authorised by her husband Matt Hutchins. Rachel Mason will helm the project.

196.title: Women sterilized without anaesthesia in Bihar, victim says 'Hurt like someone pulled nerve'
196.article_body: Women were allegedly sterilized without being administered anaesthesia at a primary health centre in Bihar's Khagaria. A woman said the pain felt like someone pulled her nerve, adding that four men restrained her during the procedure. "It is a matter of investigation. Action will be taken after probe," said Dr A Jha, civil surgeon.

197.title: DCW seeks status of CCTV installation in Delhi police stations
197.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued notices to Deputy Commissioners of Police of all districts in the national capital seeking the status of installation of CCTV cameras in police stations. It also sought details about the number of CCTV cameras with audio recording and night vision facilities and the duration for which the recording is stored.

198.title: Hansika Motwani to get married on December 4 in Jaipur: Report
198.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani is reportedly getting married to Mumbai-based businessman Sohael Khaturiya on December 4. Reportedly, the wedding is expected to be held at 450-year-old Mundota Fort in Jaipur, while the mehendi and sangeet ceremony will be held on December 3. The wedding will reportedly be a close-knit affair with only close friends and relatives in attendance.

199.title: Fake accounts on Twitter show challenges: Eli Lilly CEO
199.article_body: Pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly's CEO Dave Ricks said the recent imposter Twitter account incident "demonstrates some of the challenges" on the social media platform. Eli Lilly recently lost over $15 billion in market cap because of a tweet by a fake Eli Lilly account verified with a $8 blue tick. Ricks described the incident as "disappointing".

200.title: Gujaratis are smart, they don’t fall for anyone: BJP’s Alpesh on Cong’s campaign
200.article_body: BJP’s Gandhinagar candidate Alpesh Thakor will file his nomination on Thursday for Gujarat Assembly polls and he will be accompanied by CM Bhupendra Patel. On being asked if Rahul Gandhi’s campaign may improve Congress’ chances in polls, Thakor said, "State Congress’ leaders have destroyed the party...Our contest is with Congress. Gujaratis are smart people. They don't fall for just anyone."

201.title: UAE-based baraka raises $20 million in round led by Valar Ventures
201.article_body: The UAE-based fintech firm baraka has secured $20 million in a Series A funding round led by Valar Ventures, backed by billionaire venture capitalist Peter Thiel. The funding round also saw participation from Knollwood. The Y Combinator-backed company was founded by Feras Jalbout, raised $4 million in a seed funding round in August 2021.

202.title: Rape accused SL cricketer Danushka gets conditional bail, banned from using dating apps
202.article_body: Sri Lanka cricketer Danushka Gunathilaka, accused of raping his Tinder date in Sydney, has been granted conditional bail. As part of his bail conditions, Gunathilaka will be required to report daily to a police station. He isn't permitted to use Tinder or any other dating app. The case is scheduled to return to court on January 12.

203.title: Conspiracy to destabilise govt: Hemant Soren on ED summons
203.article_body: Ahead of appearing before the ED in the alleged illegal mining case, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Thursday said, "I am a Chief Minister. I hold a constitutional post. But the way I am being summoned it feels like I will be fleeing the country." "It can be called a conspiracy to destabilise the government," he added.

204.title: Paytm stock falls by nearly 10% after SoftBank stake sale report
204.article_body: The stock of Paytm parent One97 Communications fell by nearly 10% on Thursday after shareholder SoftBank reportedly sold 29.5 million shares or 4.5% stake in the payments company in a block deal. The company's stock dropped to its lowest since July 26. At 12:30 pm, Paytm's stock was trading at ₹549.35 apiece, down by 8.66% on the National Stock Exchange.

205.title: I frankly don’t want to be CEO of any company: World's richest man Musk
205.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk on Wednesday remarked, "I frankly don’t want to be the CEO of any company." Musk, who is the CEO of multiple companies, was answering lawyers as part of a trial challenging his $56 billion Tesla pay. Tesla shareholder Richard Tornetta sued Musk and the board in 2018 alleging that the CEO's compensation was excessive.

206.title: North Korea fired ballistic missile off east coast: South Korea
206.article_body: North Korea has fired an "unidentified ballistic missile" off its east coast, South Korean military claimed. This was North Korea's first ballistic missile firing in eight days. It comes after North Korea's Foreign Minister Choe Son Hue responded to a trilateral summit between the US, South Korea and Japan, saying accord would leave tensions on the Korean Peninsula "more unpredictable".

207.title: Narayan Rane's family begins demolition of bungalow deemed as illegal
207.article_body: Union Minister Narayan Rane's family has started the demolition of parts of their bungalow, an eight-storey bungalow located in Juhu, that were deemed as illegal construction by the Bombay HC. A company owned by Narayan Rane had earlier filed a plea with Supreme Court challenging Bombay High Court's order but it was dismissed by the apex court.

208.title: 4 suffer burns due to chemical leakage at institute in Mumbai
208.article_body: Four staff members of Mumbai's Sasmira's Institute of Design and Textiles suffered burn injuries due to a chemical leakage during a routine experiment in the chemistry lab on Wednesday. One of the victims, 20-year-old Pratiksha Ghume, suffered 72% burns. "We are trying to assess what went wrong in the lab," said a senior official from the Sasmira's Institute.

209.title: Tamannaah shuts marriage rumours, says 'everyone's scripting my life'
209.article_body: Tamannaah Bhatia has shut down rumours that she's going to get married to a businessman. "Everyone's scripting my life," she wrote on Instagram Story, which she shared in response to a paparazzo's video that speculated about the actress' marriage and relationship. She shared a video of her 'F3: Fun and Frustration' character and joked it to be her "businessman husband".

210.title: Germany-based firm Matter Labs raises $200 million in Series C round
210.article_body: Germany-based Ethereum development company Matter Labs has secured $200 million in a Series C funding round co-led by Blockchain Capital and Dragonfly Capital. The funding round also saw participation from LightSpeed Venture Partners, Variant and Andreessen Horowitz. The company's total funding has reached $458 million. Matter Labs is the developer behind Ethereum scaling firm zkSync.

211.title: 2 Mumbai residents among 3 arrested for trying to sell arms in Bhavnagar
211.article_body: Three persons, including two Mumbai residents, were arrested in Gujarat's Vadodara on Wednesday for allegedly trying to illegally sell arms to a resident of Bhavnagar district. Police are yet to arrest three others who were accompanying the prospective buyer. Two persons who hail from Mumbai arrived in Vadodara to sell a countrymade pistol as well as live cartridges, police said.

212.title: Maharashtra village bans use of mobile phones for children aged below 18
212.article_body: A village in Maharashtra's Yavatmal has banned the use of mobile phones for children aged below 18. Adding that the village school children are addicted to mobile phones, the sarpanch of the Bansi gram panchayat claimed that the decision was unanimously approved. The sarpanch also said that penalties will be levied on people who violate the decision.

213.title: Christina Applegate seen for 1st time since revealing she gained 18 kg due to MS
213.article_body: Actress Christina Applegate made her first public appearance since revealing she gained 18 kg amid her battle with multiple sclerosis. The 'Dead to Me' actress, 50, was seen while being honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Following her multiple sclerosis diagnosis, Applegate had said that she "can't walk without a cane".

214.title: Jack Dorsey posts 'Nobody knows anything' on Twitter, Elon Musk responds
214.article_body: As Twitter's new owner Elon Musk continues revamp of the social media platform, Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey on Thursday morning tweeted, "Nobody knows anything." Reacting to Dorsey's tweet, Musk wrote jokingly, "Magic 8 ball knows all". Notably, Dorsey today also said that he would not accept the position of Twitter CEO while replying to a user on social media.

215.title: They cut me out of frame: Anu Aggarwal on her 'Indian Idol 13' appearance
215.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal, who recently appeared on 'Indian Idol 13', said she was sad that the makers had cut her out of the frame and deleted her scenes from the episode. "I spoke enough but not a word was shown in the telecast...I don't want to get into blaming the channel, the editor or anybody at all," she expressed.

216.title: India reports 635 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 7,175
216.article_body: India reported 635 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 501 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active cases stands at 7,175, according to the ministry. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,546.

217.title: Won't testify before US House panel on Capitol riots: Ex-US VP Pence
217.article_body: Former US Vice President Mike Pence has said that he will not testify before the House of Representatives panel investigating the Capitol riots, adding that Congress has no right to his testimony. In an interview with CBS News, Pence said it would establish a "terrible precedent for the Congress to summon a Vice President...to speak about deliberations...at the White House".

218.title: With my immigration status, I've limited time to find a new role: Indian fired by Amazon
218.article_body: An Indian employee working as an Applied Scientist at Amazon Alexa Privacy in the US took to LinkedIn after he was fired from the company. Revealing that his entire data sciences team at Amazon Alexa had been laid off, Saurabh Vaidya wrote, "Unfortunately, with my immigration status, I have limited time to search for and get a new role."

219.title: Ghaziabad gets 2 new police stations at Crossings Republik and Wave City
219.article_body: Two new police stations were inaugurated in Ghaziabad at Crossings Republik and Wave City on Wednesday. With these new additions, the total number of police stations in Ghaziabad district now stands at 24. The Crossings Republik station's jurisdiction will include Crossings Republik, Behrampur and other localities, while Wave City station will have Dasna and Wave City, among other areas.

220.title: Myanmar releases 6,000 prisoners including ex-leader's Australian advisor
220.article_body: Myanmar’s military leaders have released about 6,000 prisoners under an amnesty, including Sean Turnell, an Australian economist and former advisor to ousted leader Aung San Suu Kyi, state media reported. Former British envoy Vicky Bowman, US citizen Kyaw Htay Oo and Japanese filmmaker Toru Kubota were among those released. Prisoners were reportedly released to mark Myanmar’s national day.

221.title: Goodera raises $10 million from Elevation Capital and others
221.article_body: Corporate volunteering startup Goodera has secured $10 million in a Series A funding round which saw participation from Elevation Capital, Zoom Ventures, Xto10X, Nexus Venture Partners and Omidyar Network. Former Xerox CEO Ursula Burns and Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal also participated in the round. The startup was founded by Abhishek Humbad in 2014.

222.title: Heroin & poppy husk worth ₹800 crore burnt in Punjab's Amritsar
222.article_body: Punjab Police destroyed 151 kg of heroin and 1,100 kg of poppy husk worth over ₹800 crore by burning them in a furnace in Amritsar. "The process of destruction was completed by a high-level drug disposal committee of contraband," a spokesperson said. Moreover, a drug disposal committee issued a disposal certificate for opium weighing 40.5 kg, the spokesperson added.

223.title: Blackstone to acquire 52% stake in IT firm R Systems for ₹2,904 cr
223.article_body: Private equity player Blackstone will acquire a 52% stake in digital information technology service provider R Systems International for ₹2,904 crore ($359 million). The stock of R Systems rose by nearly 18% on Thursday after Blackstone made the open offer for 48.33% stake at ₹245/share. Blackstone will also launch a conditional delisting offer at a price of ₹246 per share.

224.title: Bengal soon to have new Guv who will follow Dhankhar's footsteps: WB BJP chief
224.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that the state will soon get a new Governor who would follow the footsteps of ex-Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar. Prior to his appointment as the Vice President of India, Dhankhar was the Governor of West Bengal. La Ganesan took oath as the new Governor of West Bengal in July this year.

225.title: Domestic LPG cylinders to come with QR codes to fight theft and enable tracking
225.article_body: State-run Indian Oil Corporation Limited has launched a QR code-based track and trace initiative for LPG cylinders and it is expected that all domestic LPG cylinders will have QR codes on them over the next three months. "It has the potential to resolve several existing issues of pilferage, tracking and tracing and better inventory management of gas cylinders," said government.

226.title: Social media firms can make any party win election: Rahul Gandhi
226.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said that "even if the EVM is secure, Indian elections may be rigged through social media". "If large social media companies want, they can make any party win an election," he said. "Systematic bias is being applied there and my social media handles are a live example of it," he added.

227.title: Tigress shot dead near Corbett Tiger Reserve, forest official booked
227.article_body: A forest official was booked after a tigress was shot dead near Corbett Tiger Reserve (CTR) in Uttarakhand's Almora district. The CTR administration said that the forest guard fired multiple rounds to scare away the animal that had strayed into a marketplace. One of the bullets hit the big cat in its right thigh, said CTR Director Dheeraj Pandey.

228.title: Fake police recruitment order goes viral in Mumbai, complaint lodged
228.article_body: A complaint was filed with the Marine Drive police station by the home department after an unidentified person created a duplicate government notification regarding police recruitment across the state and circulated it on WhatsApp. The duplicate notification had the name of the home department secretary and also the serial number of the original government order, the police said.

229.title: Women beaten with batons by police on train in Iran for not wearing hijab
229.article_body: Iranian security forces opened fire on people at a metro station and beat women on a train for not wearing hijab as protests over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini entered a third month. Amini died in the custody of the morality police on September 16 after her arrest for an alleged breach of Iran's strict dress code for women.

230.title: 'Would you accept position as Twitter CEO?' Twitter user asks Dorsey, he says 'nope'
230.article_body: Replying to a Twitter user who asked him if he would accept the position of Twitter CEO, the social media company's Co-founder Jack Dorsey said, "Nope". Dorsey co-founded Twitter in 2006 and stepped down as the CEO in 2021. He served as the CEO between 2006 and 2008 and returned to lead Twitter in 2015.

231.title: Massive fire breaks out in market in Greater Noida; 6 shops gutted
231.article_body: About six shops were gutted after a massive fire broke out at a furniture market in Tugalpur village in Greater Noida. Vehicles of the fire department reached the site on receiving information about the incident and brought the blaze under control. No loss of life has been reported in the incident, a fire department official said.

232.title: Delhi's air quality dips to 'poor' with 249 AQI; Noida's AQI at 300
232.article_body: Delhi's overall air quality on Thursday morning was recorded in the 'poor' category with an air quality index (AQI) of 249, as per the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR). This comes a day after the AQI improved to 'moderate' category. The AQI in Noida stood at 300, while in Gurugram it stood at 235.

233.title: Crypto lender Genesis halts customer withdrawals after FTX collapse
233.article_body: Genesis Global Trading's lending arm Genesis Global Capital suspended customer redemptions in its lending business following the collapse of the crypto exchange FTX. Last week, Genesis disclosed that its derivatives unit had about $175 million in locked funds in the FTX trading account because of which its parent, Digital Currency Group, opted for an equity infusion of $140 million.

234.title: What kind of nationalism is this?: Rahul to Centre over Agnipath scheme
234.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised PM Narendra Modi-led BJP government over the Agnipath scheme, saying that 'Agniveers' will be unemployed for the rest of their lives after training for six months and working for the country for four years. "What kind of nationalism is this? They are playing with youths' sentiments in the name of Agniveer," Rahul Gandhi said.

235.title: Doesn't hamper our equation: Sunny on dating rumours with Sharvari
235.article_body: Actor Sunny Kaushal said that the dating rumours with actress Sharvari Wagh "doesn't hamper" their equation. "We understand that...these are just news headlines. It would be stupid of us to make it a reality and take it very seriously," he added. Sunny called Sharvari a "very level-headed" person, who likes to "weigh out the pros and cons" in different situations.

236.title: Bournvita's Forced Packs aim to nudge society against forcing kids
236.article_body: Bournvita shared that as a society, we often force kids to follow particular career paths, overlooking their natural potential. At Bournvita, we wanted to open everyone's eyes, so we forced the iconic Bournvita jar to be something it wasn't meant to be, it stated, adding that if you too are against forcing kids, pledge with your Bournvita Forced Pack.

237.title: Nath cuts cake with Hanuman's pic on it; MP CM calls it an 'insult'
237.article_body: After pictures and videos surfaced of Congress leader Kamal Nath cutting a temple-shaped cake with Lord Hanuman's picture on it, Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that it's an "insult to Hindu religion and Sanatan tradition". "Society won't accept it," Chouhan added. Nath's supporters had prepared the cake to celebrate his birthday, which falls on November 18, in advance.

238.title: Old Pune-Mumbai highway reports more accidents than expressway
238.article_body: The old Pune-Mumbai highway under Maval and Vadgaon divisions recorded more accidents and fatalities than the expressway, as per data shared by the highway state police (HSP). While the expressway saw 36 accidents and 22 fatalities, the old highway reported 79 accidents and 53 deaths between January and October this year. In 2021 as well, the highway reported more deaths.

239.title: Bruce Willis going through really difficult times with aphasia: Sylvester Stallone
239.article_body: Actor Sylvester Stallone has shared an update on his friend Bruce Willis, saying he is going through "really, really difficult times" with aphasia. "He's been sort of incommunicado. That kills me, it's so sad," said Stallone. The Die Hard star's family announced in March 2022 that he was retiring after being diagnosed with aphasia, which affects language cognition.

240.title: Actress Muskan Bamne responds to troll who called her mother 'middle class'
240.article_body: 'Anupamaa' actress Muskan Bamne has responded to a troll who called her mother "middle class" after she posted a picture with her mother and grandmother. "Maa maa hoti hai...middle class ya upper class nahi," she wrote. "I love them and respect them very much...please don't do such comments," she responded to the troll who has now deleted their comment.

241.title: Temasek to write down entire $275-million investment in bankrupt FTX
241.article_body: Temasek Holdings said it would write down the value of its entire investment of $275 million in collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX. The Singaporean state investor joined the likes of SoftBank Group Corporation's Vision Fund and Sequoia Capital, who have also marked down their investment to zero after FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried filed for bankruptcy protection in the US last week.

242.title: BBMP issues warning to public to not share data with Chilume NGO
242.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) issued a statement asking public to not share voter identity details with the NGO under scrutiny, Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust. The NGO was allegedly collecting personal information from public while conducting house-to-house surveys to help create awareness about voter helpline across several constituencies in Bengaluru.

243.title: 3 persons arrested for gambling in Hyderabad, ₹14,000 seized
243.article_body: The Chilkalguda police in Hyderabad arrested three gamblers on Wednesday and seized ₹14,830 cash, three mobile phones and other articles from them. "The three accused persons were betting at the time of raids," Station House Officer (SHO) G Naresh said. One of the accused persons, a labourer, used to organise gambling at a nearby auto stand.

244.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹1.12 lakh trying to get OTT app issue fixed
244.article_body: A 45-year-old Mumbai woman allegedly lost ₹1.12 lakh while trying to resolve an issue with her OTT application. Unable to stream content, the woman found a "customer care number" on the internet which turned out to be fraudulent. On the pretext of technical support, the suspect siphoned off money from her bank account through remote access to her phone.

245.title: I will continue to run Twitter until it is in a strong place: Musk
245.article_body: Testifying in a Delaware court in his $56 billion pay package case, Elon Musk remarked that he will reduce his time at Twitter and find a new leader to run the company. Responding to a Twitter user about this, Musk on Thursday also said, "I'll continue to run Twitter until it's in a strong place, which will take some time."

246.title: Karan Johar to launch Saif's son Ibrahim in his next project: Report
246.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar will reportedly launch Saif Ali Khan's son Ibrahim Ali Khan in his next production venture. The film, which is expected to go on floors in 2023, is reportedly based on defence forces and will be directed by Boman Irani's son Kayoze Irani. Recently, Ibrahim assisted Karan on his directorial venture 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'.

247.title: This news is toughest to digest: Amazon top exec to staff as layoffs begin
247.article_body: Addressing the employees as the company began layoffs, Amazon's Senior Vice President of Devices and Services Dave Limp shared a note. Limp wrote, "We continue to face an unusual and uncertain macroeconomic environment," and that this "news is tough to digest". He added that the affected employees will be helped with a separation payment, transitional benefits, and job placement support.

248.title: Amit Shah to inaugurate 1st phase of theme park on Shivaji in Pune
248.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will inaugurate the first phase of a theme park based on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj's life in Pune on November 20. Padma Vibhushan awardee late Balwant Moreshwar Purandare had formed the Maharaja Shivachhatrapati Pratishthan for the execution of this project. "This is the largest historical theme park in Asia," a trustee of the Pratishthan said.

249.title: Govt hikes windfall profit tax on crude oil, cuts diesel export rate
249.article_body: The government increased the windfall profit tax on domestically produced crude oil to ₹10,200/tonne from ₹9,500/tonne with effect from Thursday. The rate on diesel export was cut to ₹10.5/litre from ₹13/litre. The levy on diesel includes ₹1.50/litre road and infrastructure cess. The export tax on aviation turbine fuel, which was set at ₹5/litre on November 1, has not been changed.

250.title: 2 railway police officials caught with drugs worth ₹4 lakh in Thane
250.article_body: Two Kalyan Government Railway Police officials were arrested for allegedly possessing 921 grams of charas worth ₹4 lakh in Thane. The accused officials were allegedly going to sell the drugs to an unknown buyer. An officer of the anti-narcotics cell of Thane Police said they laid a trap by posing as buyers and caught the two on the spot.

251.title: Want to act again, I think I'll be able to do any role: Meenakshi
251.article_body: Actress Meenakshi Seshadri said that she wants to make her acting comeback. The actress added that because of the kind of roles she has done in the past, she thinks she will be able to do any sort of role. "It would be wrong on my part to limit myself to any particular type or category," she concluded.

252.title: No more waste dumping at Gurugram's Bandhwari landfill from Feb 1
252.article_body: Officials have said that no more waste will be dumped at the Bandhwari landfill in Gurugram from February 1 next year. The decision was made following a meeting of the committee formed by the National Green Tribunal to handle issues related to the landfill. Moreover, it was decided that the legacy waste will be processed in a time-bound manner.

253.title: What did Centre and RBI tell Supreme Court to defend demonetisation?
253.article_body: The Centre told Supreme Court that the 2016 demonetisation helped combat fake currency, terror financing, black money and tax evasion and encouraged sections of the informal economy to become part of the formal economy. The RBI said that public inconvenience cannot be a ground to challenge the validity of demonetisation when the decision was taken in the "national economic interest".

254.title: 11 ft Indian Rock Python rescued from Secunderabad railway quarters
254.article_body: Hyderabad-based NGO Friends of Snakes, which works for rescuing snakes, rescued an eleven and a half feet adult Indian Rock Python on Wednesday. The snake was rescued at the railway quarters in Secunderabad and it was assumed to be living in the habitat for over 20 years. The NGO is currently in process of relocating the snake to a forest.

255.title: CNG price hiked by ₹1 in Pune, climbs to ₹92 per kg
255.article_body: Maharashtra Natural Gas Limited (MNGL) has increased the price of compressed natural gas (CNG) for vehicles by ₹1 per kg in Pune city from Wednesday. The retail selling price of CNG now stands at ₹92 per kg. The new rate is also applicable in Pimpri-Chinchwad and adjoining areas of Chakan, Talegaon and Hinjewadi.

256.title: Amazon begins layoffs across company, expected to cut 10,000 jobs
256.article_body: Amazon on Wednesday confirmed that it has begun cutting jobs across the company. Spokesperson Kelly Nantel said, "Given the current macro-economic environment, some teams are making adjustments, which in some cases means certain roles are no longer necessary." While 10,000 job cuts are expected, the layoffs have affected the devices group and may include its retail division and human resources.

257.title: Republicans win control of US House of Representatives
257.article_body: Republicans have won 218 seats in US House of Representatives, the number needed for a majority. With the Senate staying in Democrats' hands, US congressional leadership will be divided for at least the next two years. Republican lawmakers have already said they want to roll back some of US President Joe Biden's programs, or defund many of them.

258.title: Punjabi singer Nachhatar Gill's wife passes away a day before son's wedding
258.article_body: Popular Punjabi singer Nachhatar Gill's wife Dalvinder Kaur passed away a day before their son's wedding. The daughter of the couple got married on November 14 while the marriage of their son was scheduled for November 17, which has been postponed for November 20th now. Dalvinder, who was diagnosed with cancer, was not keeping well.

259.title: Almost went bankrupt in 2004, started all over again: Anupam Kher
259.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher recalled he almost went bankrupt in the year 2004 as he wasn't a business-minded person. He added that he had to start all over again. "I'm a sum total of my failures. People started calling me thespian, veteran...which meant you should be given a lifetime achievement award...walk into the sunset...I refused to do that," he stated.

260.title: Telangana govt to build 104 link roads worth over ₹2,400 cr in Hyderabad
260.article_body: Under the Missing Links Projects (Phase-III), the Telangana government has planned to build 104 link roads worth ₹2,410 crore in Hyderabad to improve the city's infrastructure. While 72 roads will be built inside the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) boundaries for ₹1,160 crore, 32 additional roads will be built in the area's 10 Urban Local Bodies (ULBs) for ₹1,250 crore.

261.title: Dr Ambedkar's Mumbai home will be preserved as heritage: CM Shinde
261.article_body: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said that Dr B R Ambedkar's residence in Mumbai will be preserved as a heritage structure. "Ambedkar is the pride of the country, and the house where he lived is a historical treasure," he said. The ground-plus-three-storey house is located in central Mumbai's Dadar. It also houses a museum.

262.title: CM Bhupendra Patel files nomination for Gujarat polls from Ghatlodiya
262.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel filed his nomination from the Ghatlodiya constituency in Ahmedabad for the upcoming state Assembly elections. The BJP leader filed his nomination in the presence of Home Minister Amit Shah. Earlier in the day, the two leaders held a roadshow in Ghatlodiya. While addressing the public, Shah termed Patel as the state's next Chief Minister.

263.title: Kuwait executes seven prisoners triggering global outcry
263.article_body: Kuwait on Wednesday executed seven prisoners, triggering international criticism over the mass execution. State media KUNA stated some of the executed persons were convicted of premeditated murder. The executed included one Kuwaiti woman, three Kuwaiti men, a Pakistani man, a Syrian man and an Ethiopian woman. Though the administration confirmed the executions, it didn't say which method was used.

264.title: Kamala Harris to visit Philippine islands near areas claimed by China
264.article_body: Vice President Kamala Harris will next week visit the Philippine islands of Palawan, which are on the edge of areas contested by China in the South China Sea, a senior US official said. The visit is set to take place on next Tuesday and it will make Harris the senior-most American official to visit the island chain.

265.title: India will launch talks over a new FTA next week: Piyush Goyal
265.article_body: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said India will start negotiations for a free trade agreement (FTA) with a region next week. He said that negotiations are going on with many regions, including the UK, EU, Canada and Israel. India could reportedly start talks with the Gulf Cooperation Council as the region was keen to increase economic engagement with India.

266.title: Mandavi Singh appointed 1st VC of Bhatkhande Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya
266.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has appointed Professor Mandavi Singh as the first Vice-Chancellor of Bhatkhande Sanskriti Vishwavidyalaya (BSVV) in Lucknow. Singh is the former Vice-Chancellor of Chhattisgarh's Indira Kala Sangeet University. BSVV offers courses on music education in vocal music, rhythms, dance, musicology and applied music. It was upgraded into a state university in 2022.

267.title: At 11.1%, UK's inflation rate rose to 41-year high in this Oct
267.article_body: The UK's inflation rate rose to its 41-year high in October this year. Consumer prices increased by 11.1% in the 12 months before October. The inflation rate for the same period was 10.1% in September, according to the Office for National Statistics. The data was released a day before Treasury chief Jeremy Hunt is set to present a new budget.

268.title: Musk plans to reduce his time at Twitter, says he'll find a new leader
268.article_body: Twitter's new CEO Elon Musk on Wednesday said he expects to reduce his time at Twitter and eventually find a new leader to run the social media company. Musk added he plans to complete an organisational restructuring this week. "There's an initial burst of activity needed post-acquisition to reorganise the company," Musk said during his $56-billion Tesla pay package testimony.

269.title: Migrant worker from Bihar found dead in Srinagar, kin say he was shot
269.article_body: Balister Choudhary, a 35-year-old migrant worker from Bihar's West Champaran, was found dead under mysterious circumstances near Srinagar in J&K on Tuesday evening, his family said. "We have come to know he was shot on the chest. Srinagar Police sent the body for autopsy and began efforts to identify him by putting his photo on Twitter," Choudhary's brother Guddu said.

270.title: Lance Naik Manju becomes 1st woman soldier sky diver of Indian Army
270.article_body: Lance Naik Manju of Eastern Command has become the first woman soldier sky diver of Indian Army. She jumped on Tuesday from a height of 10,000 feet from ALH Dhruv helicopter. Sharing a video of the jump, Eastern Command tweeted, "This inspiring act...will set an example for other women in the Army." Manju is from the Corps of Military Police.

271.title: Russian economy contracts 4% YoY in third quarter
271.article_body: Russia's economy contracted 4% year-over-year in the third quarter of 2022, data from Russia's Federal State Statistics Service showed on Wednesday. During the second quarter, gross domestic product (GDP) fell by 4.1% year-over-year after international sanctions were imposed on the country. Russia's economy ministry sees GDP falling by 2.9% this year.

272.title: 26/11 attack survivor specially invited to Israel’s 25th Knesset
272.article_body: Moshe Holtzberg, who lost his parents in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, was specially invited to the inauguration of the newly elected Knesset (Israeli Parliament) on Tuesday. Sixteen-year-old Holtzberg recited Psalm 122 from the Book of Psalms at the inauguration. Holtzberg was two years old during the terror attack in Mumbai. His nanny had saved his life.

273.title: Was focused on reviving Tesla during crisis: Musk in $56 bn pay trial
273.article_body: Elon Musk said he was completely focused on Tesla in 2017 as the company was in "crisis", taking the stand in a Delaware court. Musk is facing allegations that his $56 billion pay package was based on easy performance targets and approved by a compliant board. Musk added that in 2016, he thought it was unlikely that Tesla would succeed.

274.title: Isaac Humphries becomes first Australian male basketball player to come out as gay
274.article_body: Isaac Humphries, who plays for Melbourne United in Australia's National Basketball League, has become the first Australian male basketball player to come out as gay. The 24-year-old shared a video of him breaking the news to his teammates. In the video, he also revealed that he attempted to take his life, adding, "I couldn't be who I am."

275.title: FTX's Bankman-Fried, celebrity promoters sued in US by crypto investors
275.article_body: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried and several celebrities who promoted the exchange have been sued in the US over alleged deceptive practices to sell FTX yield-bearing digital currency accounts. The class action lawsuit alleged that crypto investors have sustained $11 billion in damages. The lawsuit seeks unspecified damages from Bankman-Fried and 11 athletes and celebrities who promoted FTX.

276.title: Kerala's Sabarimala temple opens, 30,000 devotees visit on eve of pilgrimage season
276.article_body: Sabarimala Sree Dharma Sastha Temple in Kerala's Sabarimala was opened on Wednesday evening on the eve of the annual Mandalam-Makaravilakku pilgrimage season. The season is expected to see a 40-50% rise in devotees in the absence of COVID-19 restrictions. Travancore Devaswom Board President K Anandagopan said 30,000 devotees turned up for darshan on Wednesday evening.

277.title: G20 countries pledge coordinated steps for global economic recovery
277.article_body: G20 countries, including the US, India and the EU, on Wednesday vowed to implement coordinated measures to ensure a resilient global economic recovery for delivery of jobs and growth. The group made the pledge in the G20 Bali Leaders' Declaration after conclusion of a two-day summit. The declaration said "we remain committed to support developing countries, particularly the least developed".

278.title: Efforts to counter terror financing must be stepped up: G20
278.article_body: The G20 on Wednesday said the global community must step up efforts to effectively counter money laundering and terror financing. In the G20 Bali Leaders' Declaration, the group reaffirmed its commitment to delivering the priorities of Paris-based FATF. "We welcome the initiative by the FATF to promote implementation of international standards on virtual assets," the declaration read.

279.title: Earthquake of 4.1 magnitude hits Himachal's Mandi; no casualties, damage reported
279.article_body: An earthquake of 4.1 magnitude on the Richter scale occurred 27 kilometres from Mandi in Himachal Pradesh at 9:32 pm on Wednesday. The depth of the earthquake was 5 kilometres below the ground, National Center for Seismology said. No casualties or reports of damage following the earthquake have yet been reported in Delhi and surrounding areas.

280.title: England cricketer Alex Hales reprimanded for old blackface photo from party
280.article_body: England opener Alex Hales, who was England's second-highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup 2022, has been reprimanded by the England and Wales Cricket Board's Cricket Discipline Commission for an old blackface picture of him from a party. Hales had apologised when the picture from 2009 surfaced online last year. No fine has been imposed on Hales.

281.title: Woman demands doctor's kidneys for allegedly removing hers fraudulently in Bihar
281.article_body: Sunita Devi, a 38-year-old woman whose kidneys were allegedly removed fraudulently at a hospital in Bihar, has demanded that she be given the organs of the doctor who operated on her. Sunita, who's on dialysis for survival, was at the hospital for hysterectomy surgery in September. The incident came to light when she complained of continuous stomach aches after surgery.

282.title: Will increase women's representation in Bihar police: Nitish Kumar
282.article_body: CM Nitish Kumar said on Wednesday that the Bihar government is planning to increase women's representation in the state police force to 35%. He said presently women makeup almost 28% of the state's police force. "The increased presence of women in the state's police force has not only empowered women but also made the constabulary more efficient," he said.

283.title: 145 gm gold worth ₹7.74 lakh seized at TN's Tiruchirappalli airport
283.article_body: Airport officials on Tuesday seized gold weighing around 145 grams worth ₹7.74 lakh from a passenger at Tiruchirappalli airport. The officials reportedly extracted the gold from paste-like materials concealed in the rectum of the female passenger. "The female passenger arrived at Tiruchirappalli airport from Kuala Lumpur by AirAsia flight...on November 15," a statement by officials said.

284.title: Turkish sex cult leader gets 8,658 years in jail for sexual assault, other crimes
284.article_body: An Istanbul court on Wednesday sentenced 66-year-old convicted Turkish sex cult leader and televangelist Adnan Oktar to 8,658 years in jail in a retrial. He was sentenced to prison on several charges including sexual abuse, and depriving someone of their liberty. Last year, he was sentenced to 1,075 years for crimes including sexual assault and sexual abuse of minors.

285.title: Money took the front seat over art: Aditya Narayan on quitting TV
285.article_body: Singer Aditya Narayan, speaking about quitting TV, has said that money took the front seat over art. "I've had my illustrious career with Indian television and hosting shows. I find it very difficult to say no to...money especially when it's in crores," he added. "I did television for a purpose and that purpose has been fulfilled," he stated.

286.title: Zomato clarifies it transfers 100% tips to the delivery partners
286.article_body: Zomato on Wednesday clarified that it transfers 100% of the tips it receives from the customers to its delivery partners. "We absorb all payment gateway charges, including administrative and convenience fees, to ensure tips remain 100% transferrable," the company said in its blog post. Zomato added that the tips are transferred as and when they are received.

287.title: 4 killed as mini-truck rams into lorry in Andhra Pradesh
287.article_body: A passenger mini-truck rammed into a lorry in Andhra Pradesh's Gandepalli village early on Wednesday morning, resulting in the death of four people. Out of the 13 people who were aboard the mini-truck, one died on the spot and three others died at the Rajahmundry Government Hospital. Two people sustained serious injuries and were undergoing medical treatment.

288.title: SBI signs €150 mn loan agreement with German KfW for solar project
288.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) has signed a €150 million (about ₹1,240 crore) loan agreement with German development bank KfW to facilitate new and upcoming capacity in the solar sector. The bank said the long-term loan, under the Indo-German solar partnership, will facilitate upcoming capacities in the solar sector. The arrangement of the loan was facilitated by SBI Capital Markets.

289.title: Downey & I roasted Evans over 'Sexiest Man Alive' title: Hemsworth
289.article_body: Actor Chris Hemsworth revealed 'Avengers' co-star Robert Downey Jr and he roasted Chris Evans over his 'Sexiest Man Alive' title. "We have an 'Avengers' text chain...it...quickly was like, 'What are you doing with your hands back there?', Downey said he's being arrested, I said, 'beautiful mug shot'...Jeremy Renner said a series of things which I won't repeat," he stated.

290.title: FIR against BJP's Suvendu Adhikari over shoe comment on tribal MLA
290.article_body: West Bengal minister and TMC MLA Birbaha Hansda has filed an FIR under SC/ST Act against BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari for allegedly making "objectionable remarks" against her. This comes after a viral video purportedly showed Adhikari saying that Birbaha and MLA Debnath Hansda were "under his shoes". Birbaha claimed the remark was made as both she and Debnath are tribals.

291.title: Mobile industry agrees to phased rollout of USB-C port for all smartphones: Govt
291.article_body: The government held a meeting with electronic industry organisations, following which it said, "A broad consensus emerged among stakeholders on the adoption of USB Type – C as a charging port for devices like smartphones and tablets." Stakeholders agreed to a phased rollout of the common charging port. The feasibility of a uniform charging port for wearables will be examined.

292.title: FTX hacker 35th largest holder of Ether with $288 mn holding
292.article_body: The hacker who raided wallets of collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX has become the 35th largest holder of the Ether token after hauling almost $288 million worth of the coin. The wallet linked to the hacker swapped $49 million of stablecoins for Ether, according to security specialists PeckShield. It is suspected that $477 million in tokens was stolen from FTX wallets.

293.title: BJP will return to power in Himachal: CM Jairam Thakur
293.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur expressed confidence in the BJP's return to power in the state after the recently concluded polls. Calling the competition between BJP and Congress "tough", he said, "One thing is sure that big leaders of Congress are going to get defeated in this poll." Thakur added that female voter turnout increased in Himachal Pradesh.

294.title: Devastated, will remain available to police: Bumble after Shraddha Walkar's murder
294.article_body: Dating app Bumble on Wednesday said it was "devastated" to hear about the murder of Shraddha Walkar, allegedly by her live-in partner Aaftab Poonawala. "We will...remain available to law enforcement should they request our support. The safety and wellbeing of our members is our top priority," a spokesperson said. The accused and the victim had met on the dating platform.

295.title: Iran tried to kill 10 'enemies' who were living in UK: MI5 chief
295.article_body: Ken McCallum, Director General of the Security Service known as MI5, said that Iran's "aggressive intelligence services" have now crossed the line to threatening Britain directly. McCallum said, "[This] includes ambitions to kidnap or even kill British or UK-based individuals perceived as enemies of the regime." "We have seen at least 10 such potential threats since January alone," he added.

296.title: Cong announces final list for Gujarat polls, fields ex-CM Vaghela's son from Bayad
296.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday released its final list of 37 candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has fielded former CM Shankersinh Vaghela's son Mahendrasinh Vaghela from the Bayad constituency. Mahendrasinh Vaghela quit the BJP and joined Congress recently. The state Assembly polls will be held in two phases on December 1 and 5.

297.title: Next state budget will be dedicated to the youth: Raj CM Gehlot
297.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said the next state budget will be dedicated to the youth and asked the students to send their suggestions. Addressing the students of Rajasthan University, he said the number of girls in colleges is more than that of boys, which shows that the state government is encouraging girl education in the state.

298.title: UP govt to build Ramayana, Mahabharata circuits under New Tourism Policy
298.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Cabinet on Wednesday gave approval to the New Tourism Policy under which the government is planning to build Ramayana, Mahabharata and Buddhist circuits. All the circuits will include places of religious significance belonging to the particular period. While Ramayana circuit will include places like Ayodhya, Chitrakoot etc, Mahabharata circuit will include Mathura, Vrindavan etc.

299.title: 8 die as SUV falls into gorge in J&K's Kishtwar
299.article_body: In Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, eight people died after an SUV fell into a gorge on Wednesday evening, according to the police. The incident took place at around 5:30 pm and rescue operation is currently underway. Union Minister Jitendra Singh expressed condolences and said, "All possible assistance is being provided. Further help as needed would also be made available."

300.title: You've given BJP 27 years, try me once: Kejriwal to people of Guj
300.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday urged the people of Gujarat to give Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) five years in power. He said, "You've given BJP 27 years...Try me once...If you don't like my work, then send me away." Kejriwal reiterated his party's promises to build good schools, open 20,000 mohalla clinics and provide 10 lakh government jobs in Gujarat.

301.title: Arvind Kejriwal doing nothing to clean Yamuna: BJP
301.article_body: The BJP accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of not doing anything to clean the Yamuna river in the city, despite making election promises. BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said the Centre and the Delhi LG cleaned a 3-km stretch of the river in just three-and-a-half months. "Yamuna is polluted due to the inaction of his government," Delhi BJP President said.

302.title: AAP MLA Akhilesh Tripathi summoned by ACB in bribe for MCD poll tickets case
302.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Branch of Delhi has summoned AAP MLA Akhilesh Tripathi for questioning on Thursday after arrest of three men who allegedly took bribe on his behalf in exchange for party tickets in MCD polls. Tripathi's brother-in-law, personal assistant and another person have been arrested. They allegedly took money from a Delhi businessman to get his wife a councillor's ticket.

303.title: US man drinks 12 energy drinks in 10 minutes, develops acute pancreatitis
303.article_body: A US-based doctor, sharing a video on his YouTube channel, said that a 36-year-old man nearly died after he drank 12 energy drinks in 10 minutes. Dr Bernard Hsu said the man started experiencing heart flutters and developed acute pancreatitis, whereby his pancreas had begun 'digesting itself' due to the high levels of caffeine and sugar in the energy drinks.

304.title: Who are the top 5 Indians in latest rankings for T20I batters?
304.article_body: Suryakumar Yadav is the world number one T20I batter with 859 rating points, as per the latest rankings for T20I batters. Among Indians, he is followed by Virat Kohli, who is ranked 11th with 663 rating points. Kohli is followed by KL Rahul (17th), Rohit Sharma (18th) and Ishan Kishan (43rd).

305.title: PCB chief Ramiz Raja sends legal notice to Kamran Akmal over offensive remarks
305.article_body: PCB chief Ramiz Raja has sent a legal notice to Kamran Akmal for "defamatory, false and offensive" remarks. As per reports, Kamran had made the alleged remarks on his YouTube channel regarding Babar Azam-led Pakistan's performance in T20 World Cup 2022. "Ramiz has made it clear he isn't going to tolerate anyone running down...Pakistan cricket anymore," a source said.

306.title: Auditioned 2,000 girls to cast Munni in 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan': Kabir Khan
306.article_body: Filmmaker Kabir Khan revealed that they auditioned 2,000 girls for the role of Munni in his 2015 film 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan'. Kabir said he knew their biggest challenge would be finding the correct girl for the role of Munni. "If we didn't get the correct Munni, I don't think the film would be half what it is today," he added.

307.title: WB man kills girlfriend, confesses on social media before dying by suicide
307.article_body: A 28-year-old man allegedly killed his girlfriend and confessed to the crime in a video on social media before dying by suicide on railway tracks in West Bengal's Jalpaiguri on Tuesday. He killed his 30-year-old girlfriend by slitting her throat, police said. "I used to love her very much. I cannot live without her," the man said in the video.

308.title: Fired by Twitter after 3 weeks of chaos: Engineer who gave 12 yrs to company
308.article_body: Yao Yue, a Principal Software Engineer at Twitter, was fired from the company. She tweeted, "After 12 amazing years and 3 weeks of chaos...I'm officially fired by Twitter...Never expected I'd have stayed this long, and never expected I'd be this relieved to be gone." One of her colleagues tweeted, "Firing an engineer of Yao's caliber...means you're not a serious company."

309.title: Xi Jinping confronts Justin Trudeau over 'media leaks' at G20 summit, video viral
309.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau and Chinese President Xi Jinping had a confrontation at the sidelines of G20 Summit in Bali on Wednesday over an alleged "leak" of details of their informal talks to media. "Everything we said has been leaked to...papers, that's not appropriate," Xi told Trudeau. Trudeau responded by saying he believes in a "free, open and fair dialogue".

310.title: Dell to pay $1 bn settlement in lawsuit accusing it of short-changing investors
310.article_body: Dell Technologies has agreed to pay $1 billion to settle a lawsuit stemming from its December 2018 transaction involving its Class V stock. The lawsuit accused Dell of short-changing some investors in an approximately $24 billion transaction. The settlement also covers claims against Goldman Sachs, a defendant in the lawsuit, Dell said.

311.title: Govt receives ₹3,839 crore from sale of Axis Bank shares
311.article_body: DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said the government has received about ₹3,839 crore by selling a 1.5% stake in Axis Bank, which was held by Specified Undertaking of The Unit Trust of India (SUUTI). The floor price for the offer was ₹830.63 per equity share. With this sale, the government has now collected ₹28,383 crore in divestment proceeds this year.

312.title: Audience cares about who you date & less about films: Harsh Varrdhan
312.article_body: Actor Harsh Varrdhan Kapoor took to Twitter and praised Rajkummar Rao and Huma Qureshi's film 'Monica, O My Darling' and called it "brilliant". Along with the film's praise, Harsh tweeted, "It's become more about...what you eat...who you date than the body of work sadly...audiences are satiated by Bollywood blogs and care less about films in my opinion."

313.title: UK Paints acquires 50.092% stake in Berger Paints
313.article_body: UK Paints (India) has acquired a 50.092% stake in Berger Paints. UK Paints acquired the shares through an open-market transaction. The company has acquired the 20,000 shares that carried voting rights. Berger Paints India reported a consolidated net profit of ₹219.51 crore in the quarter ended September, up from ₹219.21 crore in the same period a year ago.

314.title: DLF, Naman Group, Adani submit bids for Dharavi redevelopment project
314.article_body: DLF, Naman Group and Adani Realty have individually submitted their bids for the redevelopment project in Dharavi, SVR Srinivas, MMRDA Commissioner said. "The next step is to scrutinise technical bids and open financial bids, thereafter," Srinivas added. The authority aims to complete the bidding process by the end of December 2022.

315.title: Novartis considers sale of ophthalmology, respiratory units: Reports
315.article_body: Swiss drugmaker Novartis is considering selling its ophthalmology and respiratory units, Bloomberg reported citing people familiar with the matter. The company is seeking to raise money from the possible sale of the assets to invest in cutting-edge medicines, the report said. Any sale of the ophthalmology and respiratory businesses is likely to begin in 2023, the report added.

316.title: India's exports to UAE rises 17.6% to $18 bn in April-October
316.article_body: India's exports to the UAE rose by 17.6% to around $18 billion during April-October this fiscal, Commerce Ministry's data showed. The free trade agreement between the countries was implemented on May 1. However, exports in October dropped by 18% to about $2 billion. Imports during April-October 2022-23 increased by 33% to $32.3 billion from the UAE, the data showed.

317.title: Demonetisation implemented after preparations, consultation with RBI: Centre
317.article_body: The Centre on Wednesday termed demonetisation as an effective measure and a larger strategy for combating menace of fake currency. In an affidavit filed in the Supreme Court, the Centre said demonetisation was a well-considered decision and was taken after extensive consultation with Reserve Bank of India (RBI). Advance preparations were made before imposition of note ban, the affidavit said.

318.title: Apple planning to use chips made in US & Europe from 2024: Reports
318.article_body: Apple is planning to buy chips made in US and Europe by 2024 in a bid to reduce dependency on Asia, Bloomberg reported citing CEO Tim Cook's comments. Apple has "already made a decision to be buying out of a plant in Arizona", Cook reportedly said. He added that Apple could expand its supply of chips from plants in Europe.

319.title: 29-year-old Bhavya Bishnoi takes oath as youngest MLA in present Haryana Assembly
319.article_body: Twenty-nine-year-old Bhavya Bishnoi on Wednesday took oath as the youngest MLA in the present Haryana Assembly. The BJP MLA won the November 3 bypoll from the Adampur constituency in Hisar district. Bhavya Bishnoi is the son of former senior Congress leader Kuldeep Bishnoi and the grandson of former CM Bhajan Lal.

320.title: Future will have Indian fingerprint everywhere, says UAE minister
320.article_body: UAE minister Omar bin Sultan Al Olama on Wednesday said, "The future is going to have an Indian fingerprint for everyone, everywhere." "If you want to see future of having a connected and enabled society...all you have to look is at India," Olama said. He added that future of technology, education, finance and other sectors will be reshaped by India.

321.title: SoftBank to sell $215 mn worth of shares in Paytm: Report
321.article_body: SoftBank is looking to sell $215 million worth of shares in Paytm ahead of the end of the lock-in period of pre-IPO investors in the fintech platform. SoftBank is looking to sell 29 million shares at a discounted rate of 7.72% to the current market price at ₹555 to ₹601.45 apiece. It had invested $1.6 billion in Paytm in total.

322.title: 69-yr-old tribal farmer killed in suspected tiger attack in T'gana
322.article_body: A 69-year-old tribal farmer, Sidam Bheem, was killed in a suspected tiger attack in Telangana's Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district on Tuesday. According to forest officials, Bheem was working in a cotton field when the animal attacked him and dragged his body towards the hills. However, the officials were unsure whether the farmer was attacked by a tiger or a leopard.

323.title: Missile attack likely caused by Ukraine but it wasn't intentional: Poland
323.article_body: Polish President Andrzej Duda said that the carnal damage by missiles that struck the country was "very likely" caused by the Ukrainian Air Defence. He, however, added that "there's no sign that it was an intentional attack on Poland". Notably, two people were killed after the missile fell on the territory of Poland in the Lubelskie province bordering Ukraine yesterday.

324.title: 32 former women IAF officers, who fought to serve for over 5 yrs, to get full pension: SC
324.article_body: Supreme Court ruled that 32 women, who have been fighting for the right to serve the IAF for more than their Short Service Commission tenure of five years, could be granted full pension. The bench, however, refused to order their reinstatement as they were released from service between 2006 and 2009. The court noted they had excellent track records.

325.title: People walked out during Salman Khan's 'Hum Aapke...' premiere: Barjatya
325.article_body: Filmmaker Sooraj Barjatya revealed that people began walking out during the premiere of Salman Khan and Madhuri Dixit's film 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!'. "I thought I had made the greatest film...when we had the premiere people were not liking it...the audience walking out with every song," he added. Barjatya stated that the film took off four days after its release.

326.title: AAP will sweep MCD polls, will implement 'Delhi model': AAP's Durgesh Pathak
326.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Wednesday said the party will sweep the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls and will implement the 'Delhi model' into it. "The MCD is in a bad condition and the situation has gone from bad to worse since 2017," Pathak said. He further claimed that the people of Delhi are irritated with the BJP.

327.title: 2 floors gutted in massive fire at Jamia Masjid near Kargil in Ladakh
327.article_body: A massive fire broke out in Jamia Masjid in Ladakh's Drass area near Kargil on Wednesday. There were no reports of any casualties in the incident. The top two floors of Jamia Masjid were completely damaged in the incident, an official said. The fire was brought under control with the help of the police, the Army and the local people.

328.title: 32 women IAF officers, who fought to serve for over 5 years, to get full pension: HC
328.article_body: Delhi High Court ruled that 32 women, who have been fighting for the right to serve the IAF for more than their Short Service Commission tenure of five years, could be granted full pension. The bench, however, refused to order their reinstatement as they were released from service between 2006 and 2009. The court noted they had excellent track records.

329.title: Central agencies quick to act against Opposition, but not BJP: WB CM
329.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday claimed that central agencies are quick to take action against Opposition leaders, but refrain from doing so when those from the BJP are involved in corruption. "Why is the BJP leader, whose flat deed was seized from the residence of one of the accused (in SSC scam case), not arrested?" Banerjee questioned.

330.title: Massive fire breaks out at Jamia Masjid in Ladakh; video surfaces
330.article_body: A massive fire broke out in the Jamia Masjid in Ladakh's Drass on Wednesday. In a video that surfaced on the internet, the fire appeared to have engulfed the entire compound and the building at the Jamia Masjid. According to reports, fire tenders were called from Kargil and other nearby areas to put out the fire.

331.title: Will-Chris slap incident will be mentioned in Oscars 2023: Host Kimmel
331.article_body: Oscars 2023 host Jimmy Kimmel said Will Smith and Chris Rock's slap incident will "come up" during the event in some way. Will slapped Chris after the latter cracked a joke on Will's wife Jada Smith during the Oscars 2022. "I don't want to...make light of it necessarily because it wasn't [light] to comedians...comedians are mad about it," he added.

332.title: It wasn't a surprise: Kane Williamson on being released by SRH
332.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson has said that it wasn't a surprise that SRH decided to release him ahead of IPL 2023. He revealed that SRH management had reached out to him a few days before making the announcement. "That's the way it goes, I had a really enjoyable time at SRH, I've a lot of fond memories," he added.

333.title: Obama hugged Manmohan Singh, called him his 'Gooroo' at a summit: Cong
333.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Tuesday said that at the 2009 Copenhagen Summit, then-US President Barack Obama embraced India's then-PM Manmohan Singh and asked him, "How is my Gooroo doing?" This comes after BJP's Amit Malviya tweeted about PM Narendra Modi at the ongoing G20 Summit and claimed, "When...Manmohan Singh returned from these summits...no one took note of India."

334.title: Italian man hit on mom Sridevi, dad Boney rushed from India: Janhvi
334.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor recalled an incident where a man hit on her mother and late actress Sridevi while she was shopping in Italy with her friend. "[Mom Sridevi] was shell-shocked...As a joke, her friend told dad (Boney Kapoor), who got so flustered, he left Khushi and me behind in Mumbai to fly to Italy to be with her," she added.

335.title: CPI(M) leader says Muhammad Ali was from Kerala, calls Messi 'mercy'
335.article_body: CPI(M) leader EP Jayarajan, in an interview about the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar, referred to Argentinian footballer Lionel Messi as "mercy". During an interview in 2016, Jayarajan reportedly said Muhammad Ali was an eminent sports personality of Kerala and raised the state's stature in the world by winning a gold medal.

336.title: Filmmakers will face consequences if Pak artists seen in any film: MNS
336.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena's (MNS) cinema wing has warned filmmakers against hiring Pakistani artists. MNS said, "It has come to hear that...Bollywood filmmakers have started re-recruiting Pakistani artists." "[We're] giving clear hint that not only in Mumbai but anywhere in India for any drama/film if Pakistani talents will be seen then related makers will have to face consequences," it added.

337.title: PM Modi gifts paintings from Gujarat, Himachal to Biden & Rishi Sunak
337.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted US President Joe Biden a Kangra miniature painting from Himachal Pradesh as the G-20 Summit ended in Bali on Wednesday. PM Modi gifted the Gujarati handmade textile 'Mata Ni Pachedi' from Ahmedabad to British PM Rishi Sunak. Spanish PM Pedro Sanchez was presented with a Kanal brass set from Himachal Pradesh's Mandi and Kullu districts.

338.title: Aftab should be hanged publicly & our women should be cautious: Raut
338.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said Aftab Poonawala, who's accused of killing Shraddha and chopping her body into 35 pieces, should be hanged publicly and "our women should remain cautious". The police investigation has revealed that after killing Shraddha, Aftab transferred ₹54,000 from her bank account to his own and bought a 300-litre fridge.

339.title: 35-yr-old man attacked with acid over land dispute in Bihar, 2 held
339.article_body: A 35-year-old man was allegedly attacked with acid in Bihar's Supaul on Wednesday morning over a land dispute. The man sustained burn injuries to his back and leg. "We've arrested two persons including the main accused...and further probe is underway," Sub-divisional Police Officer (SDPO) Kumar Indra Prakash said, adding the police were examining the acid-like liquid.

340.title: NASA's Moon-bound Orion spacecraft captures view of Earth, pic surfaces
340.article_body: NASA's Moon-bound Artemis 1 Orion spacecraft captured view of Earth after being launched from Kennedy Space Center in US' Florida earlier today. Reacting to a footage shared by NASA, a user tweeted, "Unbelievably beautiful." "Absolutely breathtaking and humbling," wrote another. Artemis I is an uncrewed flight test of Space Launch System and the Orion spacecraft around the Moon.

341.title: Ukrainian air defence system likely caused blast in Poland, but it's Russia's fault: NATO
341.article_body: NATO's Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said that Tuesday's blast in Poland that killed two was likely caused by a Ukrainian air defence missile. He added, "Let me be clear, this isn't Ukraine's fault...Russia bears responsibility for what happened in Poland yesterday, because it's a direct result of the ongoing war and a wave of attacks from Russia against Ukraine yesterday."

342.title: Pen-maker Rotomac Global booked by CBI in ₹750 crore bank fraud case
342.article_body: The CBI has booked Kanpur-based pen maker Rotomac Global and its directors for an alleged fraud of ₹750.54 crore in Indian Overseas Bank. Rotomac has a total outstanding of ₹2,919 crore against a consortium of seven banks led by Bank of India, in which Indian Overseas Bank has an exposure of 23%. The bank alleged manipulation in company's account books.

343.title: Jalan Kalrock moves NCLAT over Jet Airways payments: Report
343.article_body: The Jalan Kalrock consortium reportedly filed an application in the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) to seek control of Jet Airways. According to an order, the consortium has to pay additional payments of ₹250 crore as the unpaid provident fund and gratuity dues. Jalan Kalrock has reportedly already paid ₹150 crore of ₹475 crore approved in its Resolution Plan.

344.title: TMC MP Abu Taher Khan's car crushes 4-year-old boy to death in Bengal
344.article_body: A four-year-old boy was killed after being hit by the car of Trinamool Congress MP Abu Taher Khan in West Bengal's Murshidabad. The MP, who was on his way to Berhampore, took the child to a hospital, where he died during treatment. The accident took place while the boy was going to a nearby bank with his mother.

345.title: Williamson saves trophy from being blown away by wind during launch, video goes viral
345.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson saved the trophy from being blown away by the wind during its launch ahead of India-New Zealand T20I series. A video went viral showing Williamson catching the trophy and saying, "I will have that." Hardik Pandya, who will lead India in the series, was also seen holding the platform on which the trophy was kept.

346.title: Don't politicise: TN minister to BJP over 18-yr-old footballer's death
346.article_body: Tamil Nadu Minister for Medical and Family Welfare Ma Subramanian asked the BJP not to politicise the death of 18-year-old footballer R Priya.
