"The doctors were suspended following the report of...medical committee. We'll get...full report of the patient in a day or two," Subramanian said. Priya allegedly died following medical negligence by doctors at Government Peripheral Hospital in Chennai.

347.title: Startup park to come up near Bengaluru Airport: K'taka CM
347.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said a startup park will be developed near the Bengaluru Airport. Speaking at the Bengaluru Tech Summit, he said the plans for the park will be laid out within six months and it will cater to sectors from agritech to aeronautical technology. "With this, I think the tech summit will get a great fillip," Bommai said.

348.title: PM Modi, other G20 leaders plant mangroves in Bali; pics surface
348.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, US President Joe Biden and other G20 leaders planted mangroves in Bali's largest mangrove forest, Taman Hutan Raya Ngurah Rai, on Wednesday. PM Modi shared pictures from the forest on Twitter. PMO India said the visit to the forest by world leaders gave a strong message of coming together to tackle climate change and boost sustainable development.

349.title: Bitten by dog, K'taka boy dies after doctors fail to give rabies shot
349.article_body: A five-year-old boy, who was bitten by a dog in Karnataka, died after doctors failed to administer a rabies shot on time, police said on Wednesday. The deceased boy was bitten by a dog on October 30, following which he was taken to a hospital where the doctor administered an injection and sent him back.

350.title: SEBI to introduce cybersecurity framework to protect brokers
350.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) said it is planning to introduce a cybersecurity framework to protect stock brokers. The new framework is also looking to reduce impact of potential risks caused by cyber fraud, data leaks and hacking of trading accounts, according to an official. SEBI asked all cyberattacks to be reported within six hours of detection.

351.title: Tata plans expansion in beauty sector, to open beauty tech outlets
351.article_body: The Tata Group is planning to open 20 beauty tech stores and has listed The Honest Company, Ellis Brooklyn and Gallinee as potential partners, according to documents. The beauty tech stores will use virtual makeup kiosks and digital skin tests allowing customers to try on makeup virtually. With these stores, Tata will compete with Sephora and Nykaa.

352.title: Meta's former India Public Policy Head set to join Samsung: Report
352.article_body: Rajiv Aggarwal, the former Public Policy Head of Meta for India, is set to join Samsung Electronics' India unit, taking up similar responsibilities, reported Bloomberg. This comes a day after Meta announced that Aggarwal had stepped down from his post along with WhatsApp India head Abhijit Bose. Aggarwal will reportedly take up the position in December.

353.title: Road conditions in Maharashtra and Bihar equally bad: Jairam Ramesh
353.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh, who is walking in the Bharat Jodo Yatra, claimed that roads in Maharashtra are just as bad as in Bihar. "Maharashtra is number one in investment, but I have to say there is no difference in terms of roads between Maharashtra and Bihar," Ramesh added. The Yatra is on the 10th day of its Maharashtra leg.

354.title: Tamil Nadu govt announces free breakfast for students in Dindigul
354.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M K Stalin on Wednesday launched a free breakfast scheme for two schools and four colleges in Palani, Dindigul district. The cost of the scheme will be borne by Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) Department. The state government launched this scheme in September, which is currently benefiting nearly 1 lakh students across 1,545 schools.

355.title: Tribunal awards ₹49.3 lakh compensation to Thane man for road accident injuries
355.article_body: Thane Motor Accident Claims Tribunal has awarded a ₹49.3 lakh compensation to a 29-year-old man for injuries he suffered in a road accident in 2017. Offending tempo's owner and its insurer have been directed to jointly and severally make the payment, along with 7% interest per annum. Failure to make the payment will result in interest rate rising to 8%.

356.title: Actress Suhasini stands as surety for Elgaar case accused Navlakha
356.article_body: Actress Suhasini Mulay appeared before a Mumbai court as surety for Elgaar Parishad case accused Gautam Navlakha. A surety takes responsibility that a person who is going to be released from prison would appear before a court whenever directed. Supreme Court has allowed Navlakha to be put under house arrest for a month after he said he had multiple ailments.

357.title: Australia to open Consulate in Bengaluru next year: Assistant Minister
357.article_body: Australia will start operating a Consulate in Bengaluru from next year, Australian Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs Tim Watts said on Wednesday. In his address at the Bengaluru Tech Summit, Watts said his government is committed to strengthening its partnership in technology with India. Watts is leading a delegation of over 40 Australian technology companies at the summit.

358.title: Kerala man mistakes football team flags for SDPI's, destroys them; video surfaces
358.article_body: A video has surfaced showing a man destroying flags of Portugal's football team, put up on roadsides in Kerala's Kannur, after he allegedly mistook them for flags of Social Democratic Party of India (SDPI). The man mistook colours of flag of Portugal's team as those of SDPI's flag's. He later had an argument with team's fans, who questioned his actions.

359.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
359.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board has released a list of most polluted Indian cities today. Bihar's Bettiah and Purnia are the most polluted cities with AQI of 423 & 418, respectively. They are followed by Begusarai (400), Siwan (394), Katihar (382), Darbhanga (378), Buxar (350), Muzaffarpur (347), Samastipur (344), Chhapra (341), Saharsa (334), Patna (311), Dharuhera (305) and Bhagalpur (304).

360.title: PM Modi broke tradition of not discussing domestic politics abroad: Cong
360.article_body: The Congress on Wednesday said Prime Minister Narendra Modi has broken the tradition of Indian Prime Ministers not discussing domestic politics with Indian audiences abroad. "This healthy convention was broken after May 2014, the latest example being in Indonesia where FekuMaster once again showed his self-obsession," tweeted Congress leader Jairam Ramesh.

361.title: Mumbai private schools violating RTE Act, BMC not taking action: AAP
361.article_body: AAP on Wednesday attacked Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) for its failure to take action against private schools violating the Right to Education Act. AAP leader Dhanraj Vanjari alleged the BMC education department was not taking any punitive action against such schools and giving them a free hand to act arbitrarily.

362.title: India no more a place known for red tape: PM Modi at tech summit
362.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said India is no more "a place known for red tape" but a place which gives "red carpet" to investors. In a pre-recorded virtual address for the Bengaluru Tech Summit on Wednesday, Modi said, "Technology has helped small businesses find a big customer. At the same time, this has reduced the scope for corruption."

363.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
363.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board has released a list of most polluted Indian cities today. Bihar's Bettiah and Purnia are the most populated cities with AQI of 423 & 418, respectively. They are followed by Begusarai (400), Siwan (394), Katihar (382), Darbhanga (378), Buxar (350), Muzaffarpur (347), Samastipur (344), Chhapra (341), Saharsa (334), Patna (311), Dharuhera (305) and Bhagalpur (304).

364.title: Remove illegal hoardings or face action: PMC chief to civic officers
364.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar has asked civic officers to remove illegal hoardings in areas under their jurisdiction or else face departmental action. A PMC official said, "[Kumar] has warned of action against the officers...if they fail to remove illegal flexes across the city within a week. Such hoardings deface the city and the ward offices are ignoring the issue."

365.title: 55-yr-old biker dies after riding into pothole on Bengaluru road
365.article_body: A 55-year-old biker died in Bengaluru while trying to avoid a pothole, police said. The deceased man, identified as Kumar H, was a resident of Marappanapalya. Kumar drove into a pothole in Subramanyanagar when a tractor hit him. The accident on Monday has taken the number of deaths due to road accidents in Bengaluru since October 2021 to nine.

366.title: 23-yr-old Hyd man suffers burns after cracker misfires at TRS rally
366.article_body: A 23-year-old Hyderabad man who was hired to set off fireworks at bike rally organised by the Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) suffered critical burns. The TRS workers were celebrating the launch of eight new state government medical colleges. According to the police, one of the firecrackers misfired and triggered a fire and the man, identified as Kushal, suffered 40% burns.

367.title: Burger King parent appoints ex-Domino's CEO as executive chairman
367.article_body: Burger King parent company Restaurant Brands International (RBI) on Wednesday said it has appointed former Domino's Pizza CEO Patrick Doyle as executive chairman. As chair, Doyle won't earn a salary or a cash bonus, but will receive a one-time equity package of 2 million stock options that will vest in five years. Doyle was Domino's CEO from 2010 to 2018.

368.title: Ex-JD(S) leader, set to join BJP, found murdered in K'taka; private parts mutilated
368.article_body: Mallikarjun Muthyal, a former JD(S) leader who was set to join the BJP, was killed behind his electronic shop in Sedam town in Karnataka's Kalaburagi district. The 64-year-old was allegedly strangled to death and his private parts were mutilated, the police said. A day before he was murdered, Muthyal attended an event where Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai participated.

369.title: Jaguar Land Rover CEO to resign due to personal reasons: Tata Motors
369.article_body: Tata Motors announced that Jaguar Land Rover's CEO, Thierry Bollore, will resign due to personal reasons after more than two years in the role. He will step down effective December 31. Bollore had taken over in September 2020 from Ralf Speth. Adrian Mardell, a member of the company's executive board, will take over as interim CEO from Wednesday.

370.title: 12th pass acupuncture practitioner sexually harassed patients in B'luru; arrested
370.article_body: An acupuncture practitioner was arrested on Wednesday for sexually harassing female patients at his clinic in Bengaluru. The accused, identified as Venkatanarayana, would ask women and girls to take off their clothes and touched them inappropriately on pretext of treatment. He is a 12th pass who started his clinic after taking two-year training in acupuncture from a doctor, police said.

371.title: Night temperature in Hyderabad to drop as low as 12°C
371.article_body: Night temperature in Hyderabad will drop as low as 12° Celsius till November 18, according to the Telangana State Development Planning Society (TSDPS). The maximum temperature will be between 30-32° Celsius and the IMD said that the city will witness mist and haze in the mornings. Hyderabad witnessed the coldest October in a decade, with temperatures dropping to 14.9° Celsius.

372.title: Timings of 25 trains revised for Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat train
372.article_body: Western Railway has revised the timings of 25 trains by few minutes due to the running of Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express. Mumbai Central-Ahmedabad Shatabdi Express, Mumbai Central-Ahmedabad Gujarat Superfast Express and Bandra Terminus-Ramnagar Superfast Express are among the trains whose timings have been revised. Officer Sumit Thakur said the change aims to make train operations smooth.

373.title: Indian economy better placed among emerging Asian markets: Morgan Stanley
373.article_body: Indian economy is better positioned compared to other Asian emerging markets, Jonathan Garner, Chief Asia and Emerging Market equity strategist at Morgan Stanley, said in an interview with CNBC-TV18. "India is one of the most expensive markets and has enjoyed earnings growth in FY22, however, economies like Korea and Taiwan suffered blows due to semiconductor shortages,'' Garner added.

374.title: PM Modi gifts 'Mata Ni Pachedi' to UK PM Sunak, Kangra painting to US Prez
374.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted 'Mata Ni Pachedi' from Ahmedabad to UK PM Rishi Sunak and a Kangra miniature painting to US President Joe Biden at the G20 summit in Bali. He gifted Agate Bowls from Kutch to Singaporean PM Lee Hsien Loong, French President Emmanuel Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz. He gifted a silver bowl to the Indonesian President.

375.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states, list released
375.article_body: The IMD has issued heavy rainfall and thunderstorm warning for several states/UTs for next few days. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands on Thursday. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on Friday and Saturday, and over Andhra Pradesh on Saturday. Heavy rainfall is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on Sunday.

376.title: UK PM Rishi Sunak tweets in Hindi as he shares pic with PM Modi
376.article_body: UK's Indian-origin PM Rishi Sunak on Wednesday took to Twitter to share his picture with PM Narendra Modi. "United by friendship," wrote Sunak, followed by a tweet in Hindi that read, "Ek mazboot dosti." The two leaders met for the first time at the G20 Summit in Bali after Sunak took over as the Prime Minister of the UK.

377.title: Auto driver returns lost AirPods to owner using UPI app in B'luru
377.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver connected his phone to a set of AirPods to track a woman who had lost the earphones while travelling in his vehicle. The woman, in her tweet, said that the driver connected the AirPods to find her name and used his PhonePe transactions to reach her. He later dropped the device off at her workplace.

378.title: Won't seize moveable assets of property tax defaulters: PCMC
378.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) has put the decision of confiscating movable assets of property tax defaulters on hold. PCMC Assistant Municipal Commissioner Nilesh Deshmukh said, "We'd started the process last week…However, we have put the move on hold for now. It will be used as a last resort." "Whatever we do will be within the ambit of law," he added.

379.title: Got facial paralysis before major scene in 'Hum Aapke...': Anupam Kher
379.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher has revealed that he got facial paralysis before a major scene in Salman Khan-starrer 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun..!'. "The doctor had asked me to stay at home for two months...cancel the shooting," he added. However, Anupam stated he went to the sets and finished the shooting the same day. Anupam played Madhuri Dixit's father in the film.

380.title: TN BJP chief questions conditions of hospitals over footballer R Priya's death
380.article_body: Tamil Nadu BJP chief K Annamalai questioned the condition of hospitals after the death of an 18-year-old footballer, R Priya, following medical negligence at Government Peripheral Hospital in Chennai. "Does the hospital have all the facilities for surgery? What went wrong?" Annamalai questioned in an official statement. He also demanded ₹2 crore compensation to be provided to Priya's family.

381.title: Withdrew nomination voluntarily: Guj candidate who AAP said was ‘kidnapped’ by BJP
381.article_body: AAP's Surat (East) candidate Kanchan Jariwala said he withdrew his nomination from the elections voluntarily and without any pressure. In a statement, Jariwala said that he took the decision after people of his constituency labelled him "anti-national" and "anti-Gujarat" for contesting the election from AAP and threatened not to support him. AAP had accused BJP of kidnapping Jariwala on Wednesday.

382.title: My ex-husband gave me confidence: Kirti on her sex scenes in 'Four...'
382.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari, speaking about her sex scenes in the series 'Four More Shots Please!', said her ex-husband Saahil Sehgal gave her the confidence and support to do what she needs for her character. "He was not a guy who was insecure, who'd be like, 'No you can't kiss on-screen...have an intimate scene', which is...rampant in our industry," she added.

383.title: Aftab transferred ₹54,000 from Shraddha's account to buy fridge: Probe
383.article_body: Police investigation has revealed that after murdering his live-in partner Shraddha Walkar and chopping her body into 35 pieces, the accused Aftab Poonawalla transferred around ₹54,000 from Shraddha's bank account to his own. With the money, he reportedly bought a 300-litre fridge and kept the body parts in it. Notably, Delhi Police will conduct a narco analysis test on Aftab.

384.title: SC stays Bombay HC order against feeding stray dogs in public spaces
384.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday stayed certain observations of the Bombay High Court (Nagpur Bench), including the prohibition of feeding stray dogs in public spaces. The court also stayed Bombay HC's observation that those who feed street dogs must adopt them. The SC was hearing an appeal filed by three people, who were challenging the Bombay HC's observation.

385.title: Kerala HC stays cheating case against Sunny Leone
385.article_body: Kerala High Court has stayed a cheating case against Bollywood actress Sunny Leone. She had approached the court to quash the case over a complaint alleging she cheated organisers of an event in Kochi after receiving ₹30 lakh in advance. Sunny said she was ready to attend the function or return the money, but the organisers' indifferent attitude delayed it.

386.title: BJP uprooted appeasement politics, established rule of law in Guj: Shah
386.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Wednesday said the BJP ended "appeasement politics" in Gujarat and established the rule of law in the state during its 27-year rule. Speaking at an election rally in Ahmedabad, Shah alleged the Congress used to mock BJP over the construction of the Ram temple in Ayodhya and asked Rahul Gandhi to visit the temple.

387.title: Security guard killed in Pune, body found with head tied with cloths
387.article_body: A 55-year-old security guard was found murdered at the godown of a private company in Pune's Hadapsar area on Tuesday. Police officials said the head of the body was tied with cloths. Unknown assailants thrashed Kashanith Krishna Mahajan and killed him by tying his hands and feet with cloths, they added. Police suspect Mahajan died between Friday and Monday.

388.title: Actress Aindrila, hospitalised after brain stroke, suffers multiple cardiac arrests
388.article_body: Bengali actress Aindrila Sharma suffered from multiple cardiac arrests on Tuesday, as per the latest update. She was given CPR as per the authority of the Kolkata hospital where she is currently admitted. She is currently on ventilator support. Aindrila was hospitalised on November 1 after suffering a brain stroke. She suffered from an intracranial haemorrhage.

389.title: India's G20 Presidency will be inclusive, decisive, action-oriented: PM
389.article_body: As India on Wednesday received the G20 Presidency from Indonesia, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "I want to assure that India's G20 Presidency will be inclusive, ambitious, decisive and action-oriented." He said, "Together, we will make the G20 a catalyst for global change." India will work for collective action on challenges like geopolitical tensions and economic slowdown, he added.

390.title: Driver drives 8 km reverse as elephant chases bus in Kerala, video surfaces
390.article_body: A video showing a bus being chased by a wild elephant in Kerala has surfaced on social media. The driver of the private bus drove the vehicle in reverse gear for around eight kilometres until the elephant stopped the chase. "Everyone was gripped with fear... there was no way other than taking the bus in reverse," the bus driver said.

391.title: Veteran actor & Mahesh Babu's father Krishna cremated with full state honours
391.article_body: Veteran Tollywood actor and Mahesh Babu's father Krishna has been cremated with full state honours on Wednesday at Mahaprasthanam crematorium in Hyderabad. Krishna had suffered cardiac arrest and was shifted to the ICU for treatment and observation. The veteran actor had worked in 350 films and was honoured with the Padma Bhushan in 2009.

392.title: BJP criticises Cong leader over 'auction of girls' remark in Raj
392.article_body: BJP MLA Vasudev Devnani, on Wednesday, criticised Congress leader and Rajasthan Minister Ashok Chandna for allegedly making insensitive remarks on the issue of girls being 'auctioned' in the Bhilwara district. Devnani shared a video of Chandna where he was seen denying the reports of girls being sold for ₹10,000, saying even shoes are not available at that price.

393.title: Simplilearn raises $45 million in funding round led by GSV Ventures
393.article_body: US and India-based edtech platform Simplilearn has secured $45 million in a new funding round led by GSV Ventures at an undisclosed valuation. The funding round also saw participation from Clal Insurance and DisruptAD, among others. In July 2021, Blackstone acquired a majority stake in Simplilearn, which was founded by Krishna Kumar in 2010.

394.title: Police forcefully detained me over bike rally: Cong leader Sanjay Nirupam
394.article_body: Congress leader Sanjay Nirupam on Wednesday claimed that he was forcefully detained by the Versova Police for taking out a bike rally to put pressure on MP G Kirtikar to resign from his post for his inactivity in the constituency. "Instead of giving permission to carry out our peaceful political program, police forcefully detained me without showing...any order," he tweeted.

395.title: RSS & BJP should stop interfering in Sikh affairs: SGPC to Bhagwat
395.article_body: In a letter to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee's (SGPC) General Secretary Gurcharan Singh Grewal said that the RSS and the BJP should stop their alleged "unnecessary interference" in Sikh affairs. He said, "BJP government...[is] interfering...to complicate SGPC affairs." He alleged that BJP leaders "on constitutional posts" directly interfered in the SGPC election.

396.title: Ex-Groupon CEO's firm Descript raises $50 million in Series C round
396.article_body: US-based audio and video editing platform, Descript, founded by former Groupon CEO Andrew Mason, has secured $50 million in a Series C funding round led by OpenAI Startup Fund. The funding round saw participation from Andreessen Horowitz, Redpoint Ventures, Spark Capital and ex-Y Combinator partner Daniel Gross. With this, the total amount raised by the startup increased to $100 million.

397.title: Masks no more compulsory during air travel: Govt
397.article_body: Government has issued revised COVID-19 guidelines for in-flight announcements regarding masks/face covers. "The in-flight announcements henceforth may only mention that in view of the threat posed by COVID-19, all passengers should preferably use masks/face covers," an order said. "Any specific reference to fine/penal action need not be announced as part of the in-flight announcements," it read.

398.title: AI services firm ﻿VuNet Systems﻿ raises $5 million in Series A round
398.article_body: Artificial intelligence services company ﻿VuNet Systems﻿ has raised $5 million in a Series A funding round. Mela Ventures and Athera Venture Partners (formerly Inventus India) led the funding round that also saw the participation of Dallas Venture Capital and TVS Capital Funds. VuNet Systems was co-founded by Ashwin Ramachandran, Bharat Joshi and Jithesh Kaveetil in 2014.

399.title: Healthcare firm BeatO raises $33 mn from Flipkart Ventures & others
399.article_body: Healthcare startup BeatO has secured $33 million in Series B funding round led by Lightrock India with participation from Flipkart Ventures, HealthQuad and other investors. Earlier, the startup raised multiple rounds of debt funding from Alteria Capital, Kotak Investment Advisors, among others. The company was founded by Gautam Chopra, Yash Sehgal and Kunal Kinalekar.

400.title: Hyderabad Police arrest chain snatcher, 60 grams gold seized
400.article_body: Hyderabad's Meerpet Police arrested a chain snatcher and seized gold ornaments weighing 60 grams from him. Police also seized a motorcycle and two mobile phones, all worth ₹3 lakh from the accused, Mohammad Amjad. Police began investigating after a woman filed a complaint stating two bike-borne men snatched her gold ornaments, injuring her on her hand, palm and neck.

401.title: UK inflation grows to 41-year high of 11.1% ahead of budget
401.article_body: The UK's rate of inflation hit a 41-year high of 11.1% in October on the back of rising energy and food prices, according to the Office for National Statistics. The new data comes a day before Finance Minister Jeremy Hunt will unveil a new budget. Hunt said that "tough but necessary" decisions were required to tackle rising prices.

402.title: PETA claims Assam elephant still in chains in TN, shares video
402.article_body: PETA India has claimed that Joymala, the elephant from Assam which is in the custody of a temple in Tamil Nadu, is still in chains. It also shared a video purportedly showing wounds on the elephant's legs. Furthermore, PETA India claimed that the video released by Tamil Nadu government in September, that alleged Joymala is doing good, is "not true".

403.title: What are you adding to it as director?: Pathak on frame to frame remake
403.article_body: 'Drishyam 2' director Abhishek Pathak opened up about the debate on Bollywood making remakes and said that "frame to frame" remakes need to be avoided. He added, "Don't do frame to frame, because then what are you adding to it as a director?" 'Drishyam 2' is also a remake of the 2021 Malayalam film with the same title.

404.title: Delhi court to pass order on Satyendar Jain’s bail plea tomorrow
404.article_body: A Delhi court will pronounce the order on the bail applications of Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain and two others in a money laundering case on Thursday. Jain had urged the court to grant him bail, saying that no purpose would be served by keeping him in custody any longer. The judge had reserved order after hearing arguments of accused persons.
